<!--[if lt IE 7]><style type="text/css">body{behavior:url("/w/skins/vector/csshover.min.htc")}</style><![endif]--></head>
<body class="mediawiki ltr sitedir-ltr ns-0 ns-subject page-CM_Punk skin-vector action-view vector-animateLayout">
		<div id="mw-page-base" class="noprint"></div>
		<div id="mw-head-base" class="noprint"></div>
		<div id="content" class="mw-body" role="main">
			<a id="top"></a>
			<div id="mw-js-message" style="display:none;"></div>
						<h1 id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading" lang="en"><span dir="auto">CM Punk</span></h1>
			<div id="bodyContent">
								<div id="siteSub">From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div>
								<div id="contentSub"></div>
												<div id="jump-to-nav" class="mw-jump">
					Jump to:					<a href="#mw-navigation">navigation</a>, 					<a href="#p-search">search</a>
				</div>
				<div id="mw-content-text" lang="en" dir="ltr" class="mw-content-ltr"><p><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Use_mdy_dates&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Use mdy dates (page does not exist)">Template:Use mdy dates</a>
<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Pp-blp&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Pp-blp (page does not exist)">Template:Pp-blp</a><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Pp-move-indef&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Pp-move-indef (page does not exist)">Template:Pp-move-indef</a>
{{#invoke:Infobox|infobox}}
<b>Phillip Jack Brooks</b><sup id="cite_ref-uspto_1-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-uspto-1">[1]</a></sup> (born October 26, 1978),<sup id="cite_ref-nndb_2-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-nndb-2">[2]</a></sup> better known by his <a href="/wiki/Ring_name" title="Ring name">ring name</a> <b>CM Punk</b>, is an American <a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling" title="Professional wrestling">professional wrestler</a> who is signed with <a href="/wiki/WWE" title="WWE">WWE</a>. He is titled in the company as "the longest-reigning <a href="/w/index.php?title=WWE_Championship&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WWE Championship (page does not exist)">WWE Champion</a> of the modern era", having held the title for 434 days from <a href="/w/index.php?title=Survivor_Series_(2011)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Survivor Series (2011) (page does not exist)">November 20, 2011</a> to <a href="/w/index.php?title=Royal_Rumble_(2013)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Royal Rumble (2013) (page does not exist)">January 27, 2013</a>. Punk is officially recognized as the sixth-<a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_WWE_Champions&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="List of WWE Champions (page does not exist)">longest reigning</a> champion of all time.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3">[3]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-wwetitle_4-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-wwetitle-4">[4]</a></sup>
</p><p>In professional wrestling, Punk is a seven-time World Champion, having held the <a href="/wiki/ROH_World_Championship" title="ROH World Championship">ROH World Championship</a> and <a href="/wiki/ECW_World_Heavyweight_Championship" title="ECW World Heavyweight Championship">ECW Championship</a> once each, WWE's <a href="/wiki/World_Heavyweight_Championship_(WWE)" title="World Heavyweight Championship (WWE)">World Heavyweight Championship</a> three times, and the <a href="/w/index.php?title=WWE_Championship&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WWE Championship (page does not exist)">WWE Championship</a> twice. He has also won the <a href="/wiki/World_Tag_Team_Championship_(WWE)" title="World Tag Team Championship (WWE)">World Tag Team Championship</a> (with <a href="/w/index.php?title=Kofi_Kingston&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Kofi Kingston (page does not exist)">Kofi Kingston</a>) and the <a href="/wiki/WWE_Intercontinental_Championship" title="WWE Intercontinental Championship">WWE Intercontinental Championship</a>, making him the 19th <a href="/w/index.php?title=Triple_Crown_Championship&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Triple Crown Championship (page does not exist)">WWE Triple Crown Champion</a> and the fastest man in WWE history to achieve this record at 203 days.<sup id="cite_ref-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5">[5]</a></sup> Between WWE and <a href="/wiki/Ring_of_Honor" title="Ring of Honor">Ring of Honor</a> (where he is a two-time <a href="/wiki/ROH_World_Tag_Team_Championship" title="ROH World Tag Team Championship">World Tag Team Champion</a>), Punk has won a total of 11 championships. He was also the winner of the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Money_in_the_Bank_ladder_match&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Money in the Bank ladder match (page does not exist)">2008</a> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Money_in_the_Bank_ladder_match&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Money in the Bank ladder match (page does not exist)">2009</a> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Money_in_the_Bank_ladder_match&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Money in the Bank ladder match (page does not exist)">Money in the Bank ladder matches</a> (the only wrestler to win the match twice in a row),<sup id="cite_ref-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-6">[6]</a></sup> and was the 2011 Superstar of the Year <a href="/w/index.php?title=Slammy_Award&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Slammy Award (page does not exist)">Slammy Award</a> winner.<sup id="cite_ref-Slammy11_7-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Slammy11-7">[7]</a></sup>
</p><p>Punk initially came to prominence through his career on the professional wrestling <a href="/wiki/Independent_circuit" title="Independent circuit">independent circuit</a>, primarily as a member of the ROH roster. There, he was the first head trainer of the <a href="/wiki/Ring_of_Honor#ROH_Wrestling_Academy" title="Ring of Honor">ROH wrestling school</a>. Also while competing in ROH, Punk won both the company's championships. In 2005, Punk signed a contract with WWE and was sent to its developmental promotion, <a href="/wiki/Ohio_Valley_Wrestling" title="Ohio Valley Wrestling">Ohio Valley Wrestling</a> (OVW), where he won every championship available in that promotion. On June 24, 2006, Punk made his WWE television debut, performing in <a href="/w/index.php?title=WWE_ECW&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WWE ECW (page does not exist)">ECW</a>, which was then a branch of WWE. Throughout his career, Punk has consistently used the <a href="/wiki/Gimmick_(professional_wrestling)" title="Gimmick (professional wrestling)" class="mw-redirect">gimmick</a> of being an outspoken, sharp-tongued, and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Straight_edge&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Straight edge (page does not exist)">straight edge</a> <a href="http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/iconoclastic" class="extiw" title="wikt:iconoclastic">iconoclast</a>. Punk's straight edge principles when in character are based on his actual way of life out of character.<sup id="cite_ref-punkshoot_8-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-punkshoot-8">[8]</a></sup> Depending on Punk's <a href="/w/index.php?title=Glossary_of_professional_wrestling_terms&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Glossary of professional wrestling terms (page does not exist)">alignment</a> as a <a href="/wiki/Face_(professional_wrestling)" title="Face (professional wrestling)">fan favorite</a> or <a href="/wiki/Heel_(professional_wrestling)" title="Heel (professional wrestling)">villain</a>, he has emphasized different aspects of the culture to arouse the desired audience <a href="/wiki/Heat_(professional_wrestling)" title="Heat (professional wrestling)">reaction</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-punkshoot_8-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-punkshoot-8">[8]</a></sup>
</p>
<div id="toc" class="toc"><div id="toctitle"><h2>Contents</h2></div>

</div>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Professional_wrestling_career">Professional wrestling career</span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Early_career_.281999-2000.29">Early career (1999-2000)</span></h3>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:132px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Punkindependent.jpg" title="File:Punkindependent.jpg">File:Punkindependent.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">CM Punk in a match against Danny Dominion at an <a href="/wiki/National_Wrestling_Alliance" title="National Wrestling Alliance">NWA Midwest</a> event on November 23, 2002 in <a href="/wiki/Grayslake,_Illinois" title="Grayslake, Illinois">Grayslake, Illinois</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>Punk's first venture into wrestling was a stint in a <a href="/wiki/Backyard_wrestling" title="Backyard wrestling">backyard wrestling</a> federation called the Lunatic Wrestling Federation with his friends and brother Mike Brooks in the mid-late 1990s. He first started using the <a href="/wiki/Ring_name" title="Ring name">ring name</a> CM Punk when he was put into a <a href="/wiki/Tag_team" title="Tag team">tag team</a> named the Chick Magnets with CM Venom after another performer skipped out on the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Card_(sports)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Card (sports) (page does not exist)">card</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-chickmagnets_9-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-chickmagnets-9">[9]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-punkshoot_8-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-punkshoot-8">[8]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-jon_10-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-jon-10">[10]</a></sup> Unlike his friends, Punk genuinely wanted to be a wrestler and saw it as more than simple fun.<sup id="cite_ref-punkshoot_8-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-punkshoot-8">[8]</a></sup> When the promotion started taking off, doing spot shows out of a warehouse in <a href="/wiki/Mokena,_Illinois" title="Mokena, Illinois">Mokena, Illinois</a>, Punk found out that his brother Mike had embezzled thousands of dollars from the small company, causing them to become estranged. They have not spoken since.<sup id="cite_ref-GomezPB2_11-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GomezPB2-11">[11]</a></sup>
</p><p>He soon left the federation and enrolled as a student at the "Steel Dominion" wrestling school in Chicago, where he was trained by <a href="/wiki/Ace_Steel" title="Ace Steel">Ace Steel</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-acesteel_12-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-acesteel-12">[12]</a></sup> Danny Dominion and Kevin Quinn to become a professional wrestler. As part of the training, he wrestled at Steel Domain Wrestling in St. Paul, Minnesota.<sup id="cite_ref-punkshoot_8-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-punkshoot-8">[8]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-wojick_13-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-wojick-13">[13]</a></sup> It was in the Steel Domain that he met Scott Colton,<sup id="cite_ref-punkcabana_14-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-punkcabana-14">[14]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-joepunk_15-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-joepunk-15">[15]</a></sup> who soon adopted the stage name <a href="/wiki/Colt_Cabana" title="Colt Cabana">Colt Cabana</a>. Punk and Cabana became best friends and spent most of their early career together working in the same <a href="/wiki/Independent_circuit" title="Independent circuit">independent circuit</a> promotions, as opponents or allies.<sup id="cite_ref-punkcabana_14-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-punkcabana-14">[14]</a></sup> In the independents, Punk, along with fellow Steel Domain graduates Colt Cabana, Chuckee Smooth, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Adam_Pearce&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Adam Pearce (page does not exist)">Adam Pearce</a> and manager <a href="/w/index.php?title=Dave_Prazak&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Dave Prazak (page does not exist)">Dave Prazak</a>, formed an <a href="/w/index.php?title=Professional_wrestling_stable&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Professional wrestling stable (page does not exist)">alliance</a> named the Gold Bond Mafia.<sup id="cite_ref-punkshoot_8-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-punkshoot-8">[8]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Independent_Wrestling_Association:_Mid-South_.282000.E2.80.932005.29">Independent Wrestling Association: Mid-South (2000–2005)</span></h3>
<p>Punk's home <a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_promotion" title="Professional wrestling promotion">promotion</a> for his early career was considered to be <a href="/w/index.php?title=Independent_Wrestling_Association_Mid-South&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Independent Wrestling Association Mid-South (page does not exist)">Independent Wrestling Association Mid-South</a> (IWA Mid-South).<sup id="cite_ref-punkshoot_8-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-punkshoot-8">[8]</a></sup> During Punk's time in IWA:Mid-South, he had high profile feuds with Colt Cabana and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Chris_Hero&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Chris Hero (page does not exist)">Chris Hero</a> while also rising to the top of the roster winning the <a href="/w/index.php?title=IWA_Mid-South_Light_Heavyweight_Championship&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="IWA Mid-South Light Heavyweight Championship (page does not exist)">IWA Mid-South Light Heavyweight Championship</a> twice and the <a href="/w/index.php?title=IWA_Mid-South_Heavyweight_Championship&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="IWA Mid-South Heavyweight Championship (page does not exist)">IWA Mid-South Heavyweight Championship</a> on five separate occasions, beating stars like <a href="/wiki/A.J._Styles" title="A.J. Styles">A.J. Styles</a>, Cabana and even <a href="/wiki/Eddie_Guerrero" title="Eddie Guerrero">Eddie Guerrero</a> for that Championship. Punk's feud with Hero included a 55-minute <a href="/wiki/Tables,_Ladders,_and_Chairs_match" title="Tables, Ladders, and Chairs match">TLC match</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-punkshoot_8-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-punkshoot-8">[8]</a></sup> a 93-minute <a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_match_types#Series_variations" title="Professional wrestling match types">two out of three falls match</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-wojick_13-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-wojick-13">[13]</a></sup> and several 60-minute time limit draws.<sup id="cite_ref-joepunk_15-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-joepunk-15">[15]</a></sup>
</p><p>Punk's matches with Cabana led him to being hired by the <a href="/wiki/Ring_of_Honor" title="Ring of Honor">Ring of Honor</a> promotion.<sup id="cite_ref-wojick_13-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-wojick-13">[13]</a></sup> From February 2003 until May 2004, Punk refused to wrestle for IWA: Mid-South, because he claims that this was in protest to <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ian_Rotten&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ian Rotten (page does not exist)">Ian Rotten</a>'s mistreatment of Chris Hero in the company.<sup id="cite_ref-punkshoot_8-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-punkshoot-8">[8]</a></sup> Hero, however, has stated he believes there were other reasons, and Rotten's treatment of him was just an excuse by Punk to stop working for the company.<sup id="cite_ref-16" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-16">[16]</a></sup> Eventually Punk returned to IWA: Mid-South and continued to perform as a wrestler and commentator for them until 2005 when he was signed to World Wrestling Entertainment. His last appearance in IWA: Mid-South was on July 2, 2005 in which he competed in a 60-minute time limit draw against <a href="/wiki/Delirious_(wrestler)" title="Delirious (wrestler)">Delirious</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-owwpunk_17-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-owwpunk-17">[17]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Ring_of_Honor_and_Total_Nonstop_Action_Wrestling">Ring of Honor and Total Nonstop Action Wrestling</span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Storylines_with_Raven_.282002.E2.80.932004.29">Storylines with Raven (2002–2004)</span></h4>
<p><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rellink&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rellink (page does not exist)">Template:Rellink</a>
Initially, Punk joined <a href="/wiki/Ring_of_Honor" title="Ring of Honor">Ring of Honor</a> (ROH) as a <a href="/wiki/Face_(professional_wrestling)" title="Face (professional wrestling)">face</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-punkshoot_8-9" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-punkshoot-8">[8]</a></sup> but quickly became a <a href="/wiki/Heel_(professional_wrestling)" title="Heel (professional wrestling)">heel</a> in a feud with <a href="/wiki/Raven_(wrestler)" title="Raven (wrestler)">Raven</a> that featured numerous variants of <a href="/w/index.php?title=No_Disqualification_match&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="No Disqualification match (page does not exist)">no disqualification matches</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-ROHresults_18-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ROHresults-18">[18]</a></sup> Their rivalry lasted most of 2003 and was considered one of ROH's top feuds of the year,<sup id="cite_ref-19" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-19">[19]</a></sup> and was based around Punk's straight-edge lifestyle, with him likening Raven to his alcoholic father.<sup id="cite_ref-20" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20">[20]</a></sup> Their rivalry was settled at <i>The Conclusion</i> in November 2003, where Punk defeated Raven in a Steel Cage match.<sup id="cite_ref-ROHresults_18-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ROHresults-18">[18]</a></sup> At the same time, Punk joined the wrestling promotion <a href="/wiki/Total_Nonstop_Action_Wrestling" title="Total Nonstop Action Wrestling">NWA Total Nonstop Action</a> (TNA), in which he was paired with <a href="/wiki/Julio_Dinero" title="Julio Dinero">Julio Dinero</a> as members of Raven's TNA alliance <a href="/wiki/Raven%27s_Nest#The_Gathering" title="Raven's Nest">The Gathering</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-punkshoot_8-10" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-punkshoot-8">[8]</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:182px;"><a href="/wiki/File:CM_Punk_Raven_cage_match.jpg" title="File:CM Punk Raven cage match.jpg">File:CM Punk Raven cage match.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">CM Punk during a <a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_match_types#Cages" title="Professional wrestling match types">cage match</a> against <a href="/wiki/Raven_(wrestler)" title="Raven (wrestler)">Raven</a> at <a href="/wiki/Ring_of_Honor" title="Ring of Honor">Ring of Honor</a>'s <i>The Conclusion</i> on November 28, 2003 in <a href="/wiki/Fairfield,_Connecticut" title="Fairfield, Connecticut">Fairfield, Connecticut</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>Punk started climbing the ranks of ROH, including coming in second at the <i>Second Anniversary Show</i> during the tournament to crown the first <a href="/wiki/ROH_Pure_Championship" title="ROH Pure Championship">ROH Pure Champion</a>, losing to <a href="/wiki/A.J._Styles" title="A.J. Styles">A.J. Styles</a> in the finals<sup id="cite_ref-ROHresults_18-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ROHresults-18">[18]</a></sup> and winning the <a href="/wiki/ROH_World_Tag_Team_Championship" title="ROH World Tag Team Championship">ROH Tag Team Championship</a> twice with Colt Cabana as the Second City Saints. Both times Punk and Cabana defeated the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Briscoe_Brothers&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Briscoe Brothers (page does not exist)">Briscoe Brothers</a> to win the championship.<sup id="cite_ref-ROH_21-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ROH-21">[21]</a></sup> Circa October 2003, Punk was hired as the first head trainer of the <a href="/wiki/Ring_of_Honor#ROH_Wrestling_Academy" title="Ring of Honor">Ring of Honor wrestling school</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-punkshoot_8-11" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-punkshoot-8">[8]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-22" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-22">[22]</a></sup> having previously been a trainer for the Steel Domain<sup id="cite_ref-punkshoot_8-12" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-punkshoot-8">[8]</a></sup> and Primetime Wrestling.<sup id="cite_ref-23" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-23">[23]</a></sup>
</p><p>Shortly before a TNA show on February 25, 2004, Punk had a physical scuffle with <a href="/wiki/Teddy_Hart" title="Teddy Hart">Teddy Hart</a> outside of a restaurant that was broken up by <a href="/wiki/Sabu_(wrestler)" title="Sabu (wrestler)">Sabu</a>. The scuffle reportedly stemmed from an ROH show in which Hart performed <a href="/wiki/Teddy_Hart#Ring_of_Honor_and_Total_Nonstop_Action_Wrestling_.282003.E2.80.932004.29" title="Teddy Hart">three unplanned spots</a> putting several other wrestlers in danger of injury.<sup id="cite_ref-24" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-24">[24]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-25" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-25">[25]</a></sup> Around the time of the scuffle, Punk and Dinero stopped appearing on TNA shows, leading to speculation he was fired for the incident.<sup id="cite_ref-tna_26-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-tna-26">[26]</a></sup> Punk, however, has stated that the scuffle had no bearing on his TNA career.<sup id="cite_ref-tna_26-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-tna-26">[26]</a></sup> He said the reason he and Dinero stopped appearing on TNA <a href="/wiki/Pay-per-view" title="Pay-per-view">pay-per-views</a> was that TNA officials believed that he and Dinero had not connected with the fans as villains, having turned against the popular Raven and instead formed a villainous tag team managed by <a href="/wiki/James_Mitchell_(manager)" title="James Mitchell (manager)">James Mitchell</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-tna_26-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-tna-26">[26]</a></sup> The officials decided that as the teams as villains was not working decided to put the storyline on hold indefinitely, and thus had no work for Punk or Dinero.<sup id="cite_ref-tna_26-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-tna-26">[26]</a></sup> Punk officially quit TNA in March 2004 during the <a href="/wiki/Ring_of_Honor#History" title="Ring of Honor">Rob Feinstein controversy</a>, after having a dispute with the TNA offices over his ability to compete in ROH following a TNA order that their contracted wrestlers were to no longer wrestle in ROH.<sup id="cite_ref-27" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-27">[27]</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Pursuit_of_the_World_Championship_and_the_.22Summer_of_Punk.22_.282004.E2.80.932005.29">Pursuit of the World Championship and the "Summer of Punk" (2004–2005)</span></h4>
<p>In ROH, Punk faced off against <a href="/wiki/ROH_World_Championship" title="ROH World Championship">ROH World Champion</a> <a href="/wiki/Samoa_Joe" title="Samoa Joe">Samoa Joe</a> for the championship in a three match series. The first match, on June 12, 2004 at <i>World Title Classic</i> in Dayton, Ohio, resulted in a 60-minute time limit draw when neither Punk nor Joe could pin or cause the other to submit in the 60 minutes. The second match between Punk and Joe was planned for December 4, 2004; however, due to <a href="/wiki/Steve_Corino" title="Steve Corino">Steve Corino</a> being pulled from a match with Joe by <a href="/wiki/Pro_Wrestling_Zero1" title="Pro Wrestling Zero1">Pro Wrestling ZERO-ONE</a>, the second match was hastily rescheduled on October 11, 2004 for October 16 in Punk's hometown of Chicago.<sup id="cite_ref-joepunk_15-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-joepunk-15">[15]</a></sup> At <i>Joe vs. Punk II</i> on October 16, they wrestled to a second 60-minute draw.<sup id="cite_ref-ROHresults_18-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ROHresults-18">[18]</a></sup> In addition to <i>Joe vs. Punk II</i> becoming Ring of Honor's best-selling DVD at the time, the match received a <a href="/w/index.php?title=5-star_match&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="5-star match (page does not exist)">five-star rating</a> by <a href="/wiki/Dave_Meltzer" title="Dave Meltzer">Dave Meltzer</a>'s <i>Wrestling Observer Newsletter</i>. It was the first match in North America to receive a five-star rating in seven years—the last one being the <a href="/wiki/Hell_in_a_Cell" title="Hell in a Cell">Hell in a Cell</a> match between <a href="/wiki/Shawn_Michaels" title="Shawn Michaels">Shawn Michaels</a> and <a href="/wiki/The_Undertaker" title="The Undertaker">The Undertaker</a> at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Badd_Blood:_In_Your_House&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Badd Blood: In Your House (page does not exist)">Badd Blood: In Your House</a> in 1997.<sup id="cite_ref-joepunk_15-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-joepunk-15">[15]</a></sup> Joe ended the series by defeating Punk in the third and final match on December 4, 2004 at <i>All-Star Extravaganza 2</i> in which there was a no time limit stipulation.<sup id="cite_ref-ROHresults_18-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ROHresults-18">[18]</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:182px;"><a href="/wiki/File:CM_Punk_ROH.jpg" title="File:CM Punk ROH.jpg">File:CM Punk ROH.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">CM Punk in <a href="/wiki/Ring_of_Honor" title="Ring of Honor">Ring of Honor</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>After a try-out match on May 9, 2005 (which aired May 15<sup id="cite_ref-28" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-28">[28]</a></sup>) where he lost to <a href="/w/index.php?title=Sean_Morley&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Sean Morley (page does not exist)">Val Venis</a> on the <i><a href="/wiki/WWE_Heat" title="WWE Heat">Sunday Night Heat</a></i> show, Punk accepted a deal offered by <a href="/wiki/WWE#World_Wrestling_Entertainment" title="WWE">World Wrestling Entertainment</a> the following month, sometime in June. Even though he had accepted the deal, Punk went on to defeat <a href="/wiki/Austin_Aries" title="Austin Aries">Austin Aries</a> with his <a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_aerial_techniques#Super" title="Professional wrestling aerial techniques">Pepsi</a> <a href="/wiki/Pepsi_Plunge" title="Pepsi Plunge" class="mw-redirect">Plunge</a> move, winning the ROH World Championship on June 18, 2005 at <i>Death Before Dishonor III</i>.<sup id="cite_ref-ROH_21-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ROH-21">[21]</a></sup> Immediately after the match, Punk proceeded to become a villain and started a storyline where he threatened to bring the ROH World Championship to WWE with him. For weeks, Punk teased the ROH locker room and the ROH fans as well as mocking the championship he possessed, going so far as to sign his WWE contract on it. During the storyline, referred to by ROH as the "Summer of Punk",<sup id="cite_ref-Alvarez_29-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Alvarez-29">[29]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Mick_Foley" title="Mick Foley">Mick Foley</a> made several ROH appearances, attempting to convince Punk to do the right thing and defend the title on his way out. On August 12, 2005 in Dayton, Ohio, Punk lost the ROH World Championship to <a href="/wiki/Jamie_Noble" title="Jamie Noble">James Gibson</a> in a <a href="/w/index.php?title=Three_Way_Dance&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Three Way Dance (page does not exist)">four corner elimination match</a> consisting of himself, Gibson, Samoa Joe and <a href="/wiki/Christopher_Daniels" title="Christopher Daniels">Christopher Daniels</a>, who re-debuted after a year-and-half absence.<sup id="cite_ref-ROH_21-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ROH-21">[21]</a></sup> Punk's final scheduled match in Ring of Honor took place at <i>Punk: The Final Chapter</i> on August 13, 2005 against long-time friend Colt Cabana in a <a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_match_types#Series_variations" title="Professional wrestling match types">two out of three falls match</a>, which he lost.<sup id="cite_ref-ROHresults_18-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ROHresults-18">[18]</a></sup> In his last match, Punk was visibly crying and was showered with streamers when he posed in the middle of the ring.
</p><p>Punk made a special appearance at the ROH show <i>Unscripted II</i> on February 11, 2006, when the original card had to be scrapped due to <a href="/wiki/Low_Ki" title="Low Ki">Low Ki</a> leaving ROH the week prior.<sup id="cite_ref-ROHresults_18-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ROHresults-18">[18]</a></sup> In addition, most of the ROH roster contracted to TNA were pulled from the show because of a snowstorm that TNA officials thought might prevent performers from reaching <a href="/w/index.php?title=TNA_Against_All_Odds_2006&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="TNA Against All Odds 2006 (page does not exist)">a pay-per-view</a> scheduled the next day.<sup id="cite_ref-30" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-30">[30]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-unscripted2_31-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-unscripted2-31">[31]</a></sup> In the main event, Punk teamed with <a href="/wiki/Daniel_Bryan" title="Daniel Bryan">Bryan Danielson</a> to wrestle and ultimately defeat <a href="/w/index.php?title=Jimmy_Rave&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Jimmy Rave (page does not exist)">Jimmy Rave</a> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Adam_Pearce&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Adam Pearce (page does not exist)">Adam Pearce</a> in a tag team match.<sup id="cite_ref-unscripted2_31-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-unscripted2-31">[31]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="World_Wrestling_Entertainment.2FWWE">World Wrestling Entertainment/WWE</span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Ohio_Valley_Wrestling_.282005.E2.80.932006.29">Ohio Valley Wrestling (2005–2006)</span></h4>
<p>In September 2005, Punk was assigned to <a href="/wiki/Ohio_Valley_Wrestling" title="Ohio Valley Wrestling">Ohio Valley Wrestling</a> (OVW), a WWE developmental territory. He made his debut on September 8, 2005, in a <a href="/wiki/Dark_match" title="Dark match" class="mw-redirect">dark match</a>, where he, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Nigel_McGuinness&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Nigel McGuinness (page does not exist)">Nigel McGuinness</a> and <a href="/wiki/Paul_Burchill" title="Paul Burchill">Paul Burchill</a> were defeated by <a href="/wiki/Jimmy_Reiher,_Jr." title="Jimmy Reiher, Jr.">Deuce Shade</a>, <a href="/wiki/Elijah_Burke" title="Elijah Burke">Elijah Burke</a> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Steven_Adkins&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Steven Adkins (page does not exist)">Seth Skyfire</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-32" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-32">[32]</a></sup> On September 26, 2005 in his OVW television debut, Punk suffered a ruptured eardrum and broken nose after Danny Inferno hit him with an <a href="/wiki/Botch_(professional_wrestling)" title="Botch (professional wrestling)">overly</a> <a href="/wiki/Stiff_(professional_wrestling)" title="Stiff (professional wrestling)" class="mw-redirect">stiff</a> <a href="/wiki/Punch_(combat)" title="Punch (combat)">right hand</a>. Despite the injury, Punk finished the match and quickly recovered.<sup id="cite_ref-ovwresults05_33-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ovwresults05-33">[33]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-34" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-34">[34]</a></sup>
</p><p>On November 9, 2005, Punk became the <a href="/w/index.php?title=OVW_Television_Championship&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="OVW Television Championship (page does not exist)">OVW Television Champion</a> after defeating <a href="/wiki/Kenny_Dykstra" title="Kenny Dykstra">Ken Doane</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-ovwresults05_33-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ovwresults05-33">[33]</a></sup> which immediately led to a feud between Punk and <a href="/wiki/Brent_Albright" title="Brent Albright">Brent Albright</a>, who had previously been feuding with Doane for the Television Championship and had lost his chance to wrestle Doane after Punk hit him with a chair so he himself could wrestle Doane. They wrestled in series of matches, including one that ended in overtime with Albright having Punk submit to Albright's finisher, the <a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_holds#Fujiwara_armbar" title="Professional wrestling holds">Crowbar</a>, but Punk was able to keep the championship, as he had not agreed to the extra time.<sup id="cite_ref-ovwresults05_33-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ovwresults05-33">[33]</a></sup> On January 4, 2006, Punk lost the OVW Television Championship during a <a href="/w/index.php?title=Three_Way_Dance&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Three Way Dance (page does not exist)">three way dance</a> among himself, Albright and Doane. Doane was injured halfway through the match and was replaced by <a href="/wiki/Damien_Sandow" title="Damien Sandow">Aaron "The Idol" Stevens</a>. Punk submitted to Albright's Crowbar and was eliminated, but he returned later in the match to distract Albright allowing Stevens to <a href="/wiki/Pin_(professional_wrestling)" title="Pin (professional wrestling)">pin</a> Albright and become the new OVW Television Champion.<sup id="cite_ref-ovwresults06_35-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ovwresults06-35">[35]</a></sup> Albright and Punk then briefly teamed. They became opponents again after Punk denied Albright the respect he demanded and proceeded to continually "punk him out" (get the better of him). This feud continued for weeks with Punk always coming out on top, until a <a href="/w/index.php?title=Glossary_of_professional_wrestling_terms&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Glossary of professional wrestling terms (page does not exist)">double turn</a> occurred on February 1, 2006. Albright turned heel during a tag match, allowing the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Spirit_Squad&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Spirit Squad (page does not exist)">Spirit Squad</a> to beat Punk, turning him face.<sup id="cite_ref-ovwresults06_35-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ovwresults06-35">[35]</a></sup> Punk had a minor appearance at <a href="/wiki/WrestleMania_22" title="WrestleMania 22">WrestleMania 22</a> on April 2, 2006 as one of the <a href="/wiki/Gangster" title="Gangster">gangsters</a> who rode a 1930s era car to the ring before <a href="/wiki/John_Cena" title="John Cena">John Cena</a>'s entrance.<sup id="cite_ref-36" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-36">[36]</a></sup>
</p><p>After <a href="/wiki/Matt_Cappotelli" title="Matt Cappotelli">Matt Cappotelli</a> vacated the <a href="/w/index.php?title=OVW_Heavyweight_Championship&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="OVW Heavyweight Championship (page does not exist)">OVW Heavyweight Championship</a> because of a <a href="/wiki/Astrocytoma" title="Astrocytoma">brain tumor</a> in February 2006, a tournament was held to crown a new champion. The finals were Brent Albright vs. CM Punk with Albright defeating Punk to become the new champion.<sup id="cite_ref-ovwresults06_35-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ovwresults06-35">[35]</a></sup> Punk and Albright continued their feud, with Albright becoming more unstable and paranoid about maintaining his championship after several close call matches against Punk, resulting in acts such as threatening <a href="/wiki/Maria_Kanellis" title="Maria Kanellis">Maria</a>. On May 3, 2006, Punk finally defeated Albright in a <a href="/w/index.php?title=Strap_match&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Strap match (page does not exist)">strap match</a> to win the OVW Heavyweight Championship.<sup id="cite_ref-ovwresults06_35-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ovwresults06-35">[35]</a></sup> As champion, Punk retained the title in matches against opponents such as <a href="/w/index.php?title=Cryme_Tyme&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Cryme Tyme (page does not exist)">Shad Gaspard</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-ovwresults06_35-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ovwresults06-35">[35]</a></sup> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ken_Anderson_(wrestler)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ken Anderson (wrestler) (page does not exist)">Ken Kennedy</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-ovwresults06_35-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ovwresults06-35">[35]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Johnny_Jeter" title="Johnny Jeter">Johnny Jeter</a><sup id="cite_ref-ovwresults06_35-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ovwresults06-35">[35]</a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/The_Miz" title="The Miz">Mike "The Miz" Mizanin</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-37" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-37">[37]</a></sup>
</p><p>On July 28, 2006, Punk and Seth Skyfire defeated <a href="/w/index.php?title=Cryme_Tyme&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Cryme Tyme (page does not exist)">Shad Gaspard and the Neighborhoodie</a> to win the <a href="/w/index.php?title=OVW_Southern_Tag_Team_Championship&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="OVW Southern Tag Team Championship (page does not exist)">OVW Southern Tag Team Championship</a> at a <a href="/wiki/House_show" title="House show">house show</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-38" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-38">[38]</a></sup> They lost the Tag Team Championship on August 2, 2006 to <a href="/w/index.php?title=Deuce_%27n_Domino&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Deuce 'n Domino (page does not exist)">Deuce Shade and "Domino" Cliff Compton</a> after an injured Skyfire tagged in an already injured Punk.<sup id="cite_ref-ovwresults06_35-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ovwresults06-35">[35]</a></sup> This altercation led to a feud between Punk and Skyfire after a rematch for the Tag Team Championship on August 7, 2006 in which a healthy Punk purposefully tagged in an injured Skyfire to be beaten by Shade and Compton.<sup id="cite_ref-ovwresults06_35-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ovwresults06-35">[35]</a></sup> On August 30, 2006, a match was scheduled to take place between Punk and Skyfire for the OVW Heavyweight Championship. Prior to the match, however, Skyfire was attacked by Charles "The Hammer" Evans, with whom Skyfire had also been feuding, and was replaced in the match by Chet Jablonski (Chet the Jet) who pinned Punk to win the OVW Heavyweight Championship.<sup id="cite_ref-ovwresults06_35-9" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ovwresults06-35">[35]</a></sup> As Punk no longer possessed the championship, OVW no longer required him. He was removed from the roster and brought up to the WWE roster full-time. He continued to make sporadic appearances for OVW, such as on their 400th TV episode,<sup id="cite_ref-ovwresults06_35-10" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ovwresults06-35">[35]</a></sup> until WWE and OVW ended their developmental partnership on February 7, 2008.<sup id="cite_ref-39" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-39">[39]</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="ECW_.282006.E2.80.932008.29">ECW (2006–2008)</span></h4>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:132px;"><a href="/wiki/File:CM_Punk_2008.JPG" title="File:CM Punk 2008.JPG">File:CM Punk 2008.JPG</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">CM Punk with a portrait as the <a href="/wiki/ECW_World_Heavyweight_Championship" title="ECW World Heavyweight Championship">ECW Champion</a> in 2008.</div></div></div>
<p>On June 24, 2006, Punk made his <a href="/w/index.php?title=ECW_(WWE)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="ECW (WWE) (page does not exist)">ECW</a> debut during a house show at the former <a href="/w/index.php?title=Asylum_Arena&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Asylum Arena (page does not exist)">ECW Arena</a>, defeating <a href="/wiki/Stevie_Richards" title="Stevie Richards">Stevie Richards</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-40" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-40">[40]</a></sup> He made his TV debut on the July 4 <i>ECW on Sci Fi</i>, cutting a brief pre-taped <a href="/w/index.php?title=Glossary_of_professional_wrestling_terms&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Glossary of professional wrestling terms (page does not exist)">promo</a> about his <a href="/w/index.php?title=Straight_edge&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Straight edge (page does not exist)">straight edge</a> lifestyle emphasizing the disciplinary aspects of being drug and alcohol free.<sup id="cite_ref-41" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-41">[41]</a></sup> Although he had retained the straight edge gimmick, he now had a <a href="/wiki/Muay_Thai" title="Muay Thai">Muay Thai</a> training background. Punk made his TV wrestling debut on August 1, 2006 at the <a href="/wiki/Hammerstein_Ballroom" title="Hammerstein Ballroom">Hammerstein Ballroom</a>, defeating <a href="/wiki/Justin_Credible" title="Justin Credible">Justin Credible</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-42" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-42">[42]</a></sup> CM Punk established himself in ECW by going undefeated, defeating opponents such as <a href="/wiki/C._W._Anderson" title="C. W. Anderson">Christopher W. Anderson</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-43" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-43">[43]</a></sup> Stevie Richards<sup id="cite_ref-44" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-44">[44]</a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/Shannon_Moore" title="Shannon Moore">Shannon Moore</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-moore1_45-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-moore1-45">[45]</a></sup>
</p><p>Soon after, Punk began feuding with <a href="/wiki/Mike_Knox" title="Mike Knox">Mike Knox</a> after Knox's girlfriend, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Kelly_Kelly&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Kelly Kelly (page does not exist)">Kelly Kelly</a>, was seen to have feelings for Punk.<sup id="cite_ref-moore1_45-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-moore1-45">[45]</a></sup> Punk defeated Knox in their first singles match (qualifying for the <a href="/wiki/Elimination_Chamber" title="Elimination Chamber">Extreme Elimination Chamber</a> at <a href="/w/index.php?title=December_to_Dismember_(2006)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="December to Dismember (2006) (page does not exist)">December to Dismember</a> in the process)<sup id="cite_ref-46" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-46">[46]</a></sup> as well as the rematch, after which Kelly Kelly celebrated CM Punk's victory over her boyfriend.<sup id="cite_ref-47" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-47">[47]</a></sup> Punk then teamed with <a href="/wiki/D-Generation_X" title="D-Generation X">D-Generation X</a> and the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Hardy_Boyz&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Hardy Boyz (page does not exist)">Hardy Boyz</a> in their <a href="/w/index.php?title=Survivor_Series_(2006)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Survivor Series (2006) (page does not exist)">Survivor Series</a> match against <a href="/w/index.php?title=Rated-RKO&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Rated-RKO (page does not exist)">Rated-RKO</a>, Knox, <a href="/w/index.php?title=John_Morrison_(wrestler)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="John Morrison (wrestler) (page does not exist)">Johnny Nitro</a> and <a href="/wiki/Gregory_Helms" title="Gregory Helms">Gregory Helms</a>, a match in which all the participants on DX's side survived elimination.<sup id="cite_ref-48" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-48">[48]</a></sup> At December to Dismember, Punk participated in the Elimination Chamber for the <a href="/wiki/ECW_World_Heavyweight_Championship" title="ECW World Heavyweight Championship">ECW World Championship</a>; however, he was the first person eliminated by <a href="/wiki/Rob_Van_Dam" title="Rob Van Dam">Rob Van Dam</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-49" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-49">[49]</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:132px;"><a href="/wiki/File:CM_Punk_ECW_Champion.jpg" title="File:CM Punk ECW Champion.jpg">File:CM Punk ECW Champion.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">CM Punk as ECW Champion on September 30, 2007 in <a href="/wiki/Hammond,_Indiana" title="Hammond, Indiana">Hammond, Indiana</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>Following the pay-per-view, Punk entered into a feud with <a href="/w/index.php?title=Bob_Holly&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Bob Holly (page does not exist)">Hardcore Holly</a>, who ended Punk's six-month unbeaten streak in singles competition on January 9, 2007.<sup id="cite_ref-50" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-50">[50]</a></sup> Punk went on to feud with <a href="/wiki/Matt_Striker" title="Matt Striker">Matt Striker</a>, who gave him his second singles loss since being in ECW on January 30.<sup id="cite_ref-51" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-51">[51]</a></sup> Punk then qualified for the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Money_in_the_Bank_ladder_match&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Money in the Bank ladder match (page does not exist)">Money in the Bank ladder match</a> at <a href="/w/index.php?title=WrestleMania_23&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WrestleMania 23 (page does not exist)">WrestleMania 23</a> by defeating Johnny Nitro.<sup id="cite_ref-52" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-52">[52]</a></sup> In the final week leading up to WrestleMania 23, Punk made appearances on both <i><a href="/wiki/WWE_Raw" title="WWE Raw">Raw</a></i> and <i><a href="/wiki/WWE_SmackDown" title="WWE SmackDown">Friday Night SmackDown!</a></i>, defeating <a href="/wiki/Kenny_Dykstra" title="Kenny Dykstra">Kenny Dykstra</a><sup id="cite_ref-53" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-53">[53]</a></sup> and former <a href="/wiki/World_Heavyweight_Championship_(WWE)" title="World Heavyweight Championship (WWE)">World Heavyweight Champion</a> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Booker_T_(wrestler)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Booker T (wrestler) (page does not exist)">King Booker</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-54" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-54">[54]</a></sup> respectively. At WrestleMania 23, Punk competed in, but did not win, the Money in the Bank ladder match, being knocked off the ladder just seconds before the winner, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ken_Anderson_(wrestler)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ken Anderson (wrestler) (page does not exist)">Mr. Kennedy</a>, claimed the briefcase.<sup id="cite_ref-55" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-55">[55]</a></sup>
</p><p>On the April 10, 2007 <i>ECW on Sci Fi</i>, Punk briefly became a <a href="/wiki/Heel_(professional_wrestling)" title="Heel (professional wrestling)">villain</a> by officially joining the <a href="/w/index.php?title=New_Breed_(ECW)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="New Breed (ECW) (page does not exist)">New Breed</a> alliance,<sup id="cite_ref-56" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-56">[56]</a></sup> after several weeks in which both the New Breed and the <a href="/w/index.php?title=ECW_Originals&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="ECW Originals (page does not exist)">ECW Originals</a> had attempted to recruit him.<sup id="cite_ref-57" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-57">[57]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-58" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-58">[58]</a></sup> Two weeks later, however, Punk betrayed the New Breed during a <a href="/w/index.php?title=Professional_wrestling_tag_team_match_types&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Professional wrestling tag team match types (page does not exist)">four on four</a> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Survivor_Series_Match&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Survivor Series Match (page does not exist)">elimination match</a> between the New Breed and ECW Originals by kicking New Breed leader Elijah Burke in the back of the head and costing them the match. After the match, Punk proceeded to deliver his finisher, the <a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_attacks#Go_To_Sleep" title="Professional wrestling attacks">Go To Sleep</a>, on Burke and sarcastically apologized before leaving the ring alone, becoming a <a href="/wiki/Face_(professional_wrestling)" title="Face (professional wrestling)">fan favorite</a> again. WWE.com later confirmed that Punk was no longer a member of the New Breed.<sup id="cite_ref-59" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-59">[59]</a></sup> At <a href="/w/index.php?title=Judgment_Day_(2007)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Judgment Day (2007) (page does not exist)">Judgment Day</a>, Punk wrestled and defeated Burke in his first singles match on a pay-per-view.<sup id="cite_ref-60" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-60">[60]</a></sup> Punk then went on to <a href="/w/index.php?title=One_Night_Stand_(2007)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="One Night Stand (2007) (page does not exist)">One Night Stand</a> and teamed up with <a href="/wiki/Tommy_Dreamer" title="Tommy Dreamer">Tommy Dreamer</a> and <a href="/wiki/The_Sandman_(wrestler)" title="The Sandman (wrestler)">The Sandman</a> in a <a href="/w/index.php?title=Tables_match&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Tables match (page does not exist)">tables match</a> to defeat the New Breed.<sup id="cite_ref-61" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-61">[61]</a></sup>
</p><p>When ECW Champion <a href="/wiki/Bobby_Lashley" title="Bobby Lashley">Bobby Lashley</a> was <a href="/w/index.php?title=2007_WWE_Draft&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2007 WWE Draft (page does not exist)">drafted</a> to Raw and stripped of the ECW Championship, a tournament to declare a new champion was held, with Punk, Elijah Burke, <a href="/wiki/Monty_Brown" title="Monty Brown">Marcus Cor Von</a> and <a href="/wiki/Chris_Benoit" title="Chris Benoit">Chris Benoit</a>. Punk defeated Marcus Cor Von on the June 19 <i>ECW on Sci Fi</i>. He was meant to face Chris Benoit at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Vengeance:_Night_of_Champions&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Vengeance: Night of Champions (page does not exist)">Vengeance: Night of Champions</a> for the ECW Championship,<sup id="cite_ref-62" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-62">[62]</a></sup> but Benoit was hastily replaced by Johnny Nitro when Benoit <a href="/w/index.php?title=No_show_(professional_wrestling)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="No show (professional wrestling) (page does not exist)">no-showed</a>, after <a href="/w/index.php?title=Chris_Benoit_double_murder_and_suicide&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Chris Benoit double murder and suicide (page does not exist)">killing his family and self</a>. Nitro subsequently defeated Punk at Vengeance for the vacant championship.<sup id="cite_ref-63" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-63">[63]</a></sup> Punk won another shot at the title at <a href="/w/index.php?title=The_Great_American_Bash_(2007)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="The Great American Bash (2007) (page does not exist)">The Great American Bash</a> against Nitro, who had changed his moniker to John Morrison by this point; however, Punk was defeated again by Morrison.<sup id="cite_ref-64" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-64">[64]</a></sup> The next week, Punk challenged Elijah Burke and Tommy Dreamer in a <a href="/w/index.php?title=Triple_Threat_match&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Triple Threat match (page does not exist)">triple threat match</a> to determine the next competitor in Morrison's <a href="/w/index.php?title=The_Dirt_Sheet&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="The Dirt Sheet (page does not exist)">15 Minutes of Fame Challenge</a>, in which Punk came out victorious.<sup id="cite_ref-65" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-65">[65]</a></sup> A week later, Punk defeated Morrison with the Go To Sleep to earn an ECW Championship title match at <a href="/w/index.php?title=SummerSlam_(2007)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="SummerSlam (2007) (page does not exist)">SummerSlam</a>. At SummerSlam, however, Punk lost the match when Morrison used the ropes for leverage.<sup id="cite_ref-66" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-66">[66]</a></sup>
</p><p>At the September 1, 2007 (aired September 4) <i>ECW</i> taping, in a "last chance" title match, Punk defeated Morrison for the ECW Championship.<sup id="cite_ref-67" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-67">[67]</a></sup> Punk then went on to have successful title defenses against the likes of Elijah Burke (at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Unforgiven_(2007)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Unforgiven (2007) (page does not exist)">Unforgiven</a>),<sup id="cite_ref-68" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-68">[68]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Nelson_Frazier,_Jr." title="Nelson Frazier, Jr.">Big Daddy V</a> via disqualification (at <a href="/w/index.php?title=No_Mercy_(2007)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="No Mercy (2007) (page does not exist)">No Mercy</a>)<sup id="cite_ref-69" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-69">[69]</a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/The_Miz" title="The Miz">The Miz</a> (at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Cyber_Sunday_(2007)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Cyber Sunday (2007) (page does not exist)">Cyber Sunday</a>).<sup id="cite_ref-70" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-70">[70]</a></sup> On the November 6, 2007 <i>ECW</i>, Punk retained the ECW Championship in a match against Morrison following The Miz's interference.<sup id="cite_ref-71" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-71">[71]</a></sup> At <a href="/w/index.php?title=Survivor_Series_(2007)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Survivor Series (2007) (page does not exist)">Survivor Series</a>, Punk retained his title in a Triple Threat match, beating The Miz and John Morrison.<sup id="cite_ref-72" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-72">[72]</a></sup> On the January 22, 2008 <i>ECW</i>, <a href="/wiki/Chavo_Guerrero,_Jr." title="Chavo Guerrero, Jr.">Chavo Guerrero</a> defeated CM Punk in a <a href="/w/index.php?title=No_Disqualification_match&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="No Disqualification match (page does not exist)">No Disqualification match</a> to win the ECW Championship after <a href="/wiki/Edge_(wrestler)" title="Edge (wrestler)">Edge</a>, (acting as a guest commentator at ringside) ran in and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Spear_(wrestling)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Spear (wrestling) (page does not exist)">speared</a> Punk.<sup id="cite_ref-73" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-73">[73]</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Money_in_the_Bank_and_World_Heavyweight_Champion_.282008.E2.80.932009.29">Money in the Bank and World Heavyweight Champion (2008–2009)</span></h4>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:132px;"><a href="/wiki/File:CMPunkMoneyInTheBank.JPG" title="File:CMPunkMoneyInTheBank.JPG">File:CMPunkMoneyInTheBank.JPG</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">CM Punk in April 2008 with his first of two <a href="/w/index.php?title=Money_in_the_Bank_ladder_match&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Money in the Bank ladder match (page does not exist)">Money in the Bank</a> briefcases.</div></div></div>
<p>At <a href="/w/index.php?title=WrestleMania_XXIV&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WrestleMania XXIV (page does not exist)">WrestleMania XXIV</a>, Punk won the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Money_in_the_Bank_ladder_match&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Money in the Bank ladder match (page does not exist)">Money in the Bank ladder match</a>, after defeating <a href="/wiki/Chris_Jericho" title="Chris Jericho">Chris Jericho</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Montel_Vontavious_Porter&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Montel Vontavious Porter (page does not exist)">Montel Vontavious Porter</a>, <a href="/wiki/Shelton_Benjamin" title="Shelton Benjamin">Shelton Benjamin</a>, John Morrison, Mr. Kennedy and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Carly_Col%C3%B3n&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Carly Colón (page does not exist)">Carlito</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-MITBResult_74-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-MITBResult-74">[74]</a></sup>
</p><p>On the June 23, 2008 <i><a href="/wiki/WWE_Raw" title="WWE Raw">Raw</a></i>, CM Punk was drafted to the Raw brand during the <a href="/w/index.php?title=2008_WWE_Draft&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2008 WWE Draft (page does not exist)">2008 WWE Draft</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-75" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-75">[75]</a></sup> His first night on <i>Raw</i> came the following week, and he made an immediate impact. After <a href="/wiki/Dave_Batista" title="Dave Batista">Batista</a> beat down <a href="/wiki/World_Heavyweight_Championship_(WWE)" title="World Heavyweight Championship (WWE)">World Heavyweight Champion</a> Edge and left him lying in the ring, Punk and referee <a href="/wiki/Mike_Chioda" title="Mike Chioda">Mike Chioda</a> ran to the ring with Punk carrying his <a href="/w/index.php?title=Money_in_the_Bank_ladder_match&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Money in the Bank ladder match (page does not exist)">Money in the Bank</a> contract. Moments later, as Edge was struggling to get up, Punk hit him with the Go to Sleep and pinned him to win the World Heavyweight Championship (and later, the <a href="/w/index.php?title=2008_Slammy_Awards&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2008 Slammy Awards (page does not exist)">Slammy Award</a> for the "Oh my God" Moment of the Year.<sup id="cite_ref-Slammy_76-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Slammy-76">[76]</a></sup>). Later that night, Punk made his first defense of the title against <a href="/wiki/John_Layfield" title="John Layfield">JBL</a>, who had challenged him shortly after his win.<sup id="cite_ref-77" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-77">[77]</a></sup> Punk continued to hold and defend the title until <a href="/w/index.php?title=Unforgiven_(2008)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Unforgiven (2008) (page does not exist)">Unforgiven</a> on September 7, 2008. Before the <a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_match_types#Championship_Scramble" title="Professional wrestling match types">Championship Scramble</a> match, Punk was attacked by an early version of <a href="/w/index.php?title=The_Legacy_(professional_wrestling)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="The Legacy (professional wrestling) (page does not exist)">The Legacy</a> (<a href="/wiki/Randy_Orton" title="Randy Orton">Randy Orton</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Cody_Rhodes&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Cody Rhodes (page does not exist)">Cody Rhodes</a> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ted_DiBiase,_Jr.&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ted DiBiase, Jr. (page does not exist)">Ted DiBiase</a> with <a href="/w/index.php?title=Afa_Anoa%CA%BBi,_Jr.&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Afa Anoaʻi, Jr. (page does not exist)">Manu</a>). Orton finished the assault by <a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_attacks#Punt" title="Professional wrestling attacks">punting</a> Punk in the head.<sup id="cite_ref-78" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-78">[78]</a></sup> Punk could not participate in the match due to the attack and so forfeited the title. He was replaced by Chris Jericho, who won the match and the title.<sup id="cite_ref-79" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-79">[79]</a></sup> He received a rematch eight days later on the September 15 <i>Raw</i>, where he failed to regain the title in a <a href="/wiki/Steel_cage_match" title="Steel cage match" class="mw-redirect">steel cage match</a> against Jericho.<sup id="cite_ref-80" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-80">[80]</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:132px;"><a href="/wiki/File:CM_Punk_WHC_SummerSlam_2008.jpg" title="File:CM Punk WHC SummerSlam 2008.jpg">File:CM Punk WHC SummerSlam 2008.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">CM Punk as <a href="/wiki/World_Heavyweight_Championship_(WWE)" title="World Heavyweight Championship (WWE)">World Heavyweight Champion</a> during his first reign at <a href="/w/index.php?title=SummerSlam_(2008)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="SummerSlam (2008) (page does not exist)">SummerSlam</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>On the October 27, 2008 <i>Raw</i>, Punk and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Kofi_Kingston&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Kofi Kingston (page does not exist)">Kofi Kingston</a> defeated Cody Rhodes and Ted DiBiase to win the <a href="/wiki/World_Tag_Team_Championship_(WWE)" title="World Tag Team Championship (WWE)">World Tag Team Championship</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-81" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-81">[81]</a></sup> The duo were members of Team Batista at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Survivor_Series_(2008)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Survivor Series (2008) (page does not exist)">Survivor Series</a>, where their team lost to Team Orton.<sup id="cite_ref-82" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-82">[82]</a></sup> Punk then entered in a number one contender <a href="/wiki/WWE_Intercontinental_Championship" title="WWE Intercontinental Championship">Intercontinental Championship</a> Tournament. He defeated <a href="/wiki/Gene_Snitsky" title="Gene Snitsky">Snitsky</a> and John Morrison in the first two rounds.<sup id="cite_ref-ICtorn_83-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ICtorn-83">[83]</a></sup> Punk and Kingston lost the World Tag Team Championship to <a href="/w/index.php?title=John_Morrison_and_The_Miz&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="John Morrison and The Miz (page does not exist)">John Morrison and The Miz</a> at a <a href="/wiki/House_show" title="House show">live event</a> on December 13, 2008.<sup id="cite_ref-84" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-84">[84]</a></sup> The next day Punk defeated Rey Mysterio at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Armageddon_(2008)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Armageddon (2008) (page does not exist)">Armageddon</a> to win the tournament.<sup id="cite_ref-ICtorn_83-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ICtorn-83">[83]</a></sup> On the January 5 <i>Raw</i>, Punk received his title match against <a href="/wiki/William_Regal" title="William Regal">William Regal</a>, which ended in a disqualification, when Regal grabbed the referee's jersey.<sup id="cite_ref-85" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-85">[85]</a></sup> Due to this, <a href="/wiki/Stephanie_McMahon" title="Stephanie McMahon">Stephanie McMahon</a> awarded Punk a rematch the following week, but this time it was himself that was disqualified.<sup id="cite_ref-86" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-86">[86]</a></sup> McMahon awarded him another rematch, this time a No Disqualification match on January 19 <i>Raw</i>, Punk won the match and the title.<sup id="cite_ref-87" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-87">[87]</a></sup> With this win, he became the nineteenth <a href="/w/index.php?title=Triple_Crown_Championship&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Triple Crown Championship (page does not exist)">Triple Crown Champion</a>. Also, the victory made him the man to accomplish the Triple Crown in the fastest amount of time, shattering Kevin Nash's old record.<sup id="cite_ref-move1_88-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-move1-88">[88]</a></sup> Punk lost the title on the March 9 <i>Raw</i> to <a href="/wiki/John_Layfield" title="John Layfield">John "Bradshaw" Layfield</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-89" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-89">[89]</a></sup> At <a href="/w/index.php?title=WrestleMania_XXV&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WrestleMania XXV (page does not exist)">WrestleMania XXV</a>, Punk won the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Money_in_the_Bank_ladder_match&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Money in the Bank ladder match (page does not exist)">Money in the Bank ladder match</a> and became the first person to win the match twice.<sup id="cite_ref-MITB2_90-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-MITB2-90">[90]</a></sup>
</p><p>On April 13, 2009 during the <a href="/w/index.php?title=2009_WWE_Draft&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2009 WWE Draft (page does not exist)">2009 WWE Draft</a>, Punk was drafted from Raw to SmackDown.<sup id="cite_ref-91" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-91">[91]</a></sup> In the period after the draft, Punk feuded with <a href="/wiki/Umaga_(wrestler)" title="Umaga (wrestler)">Umaga</a> over Umaga's repeated surprise attacks while Punk was attempting to cash in his Money in the Bank Contract. This ultimately resulted in a <a href="/w/index.php?title=Strap_match&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Strap match (page does not exist)">Samoan strap match</a> at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Extreme_Rules_(2009)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Extreme Rules (2009) (page does not exist)">Extreme Rules</a>, which was won by Punk.<sup id="cite_ref-92" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-92">[92]</a></sup>
</p><p>At the end of the pay-per-view, Punk cashed in his Money in the Bank contract to defeat <a href="/wiki/Jeff_Hardy" title="Jeff Hardy">Jeff Hardy</a> for the World Heavyweight Championship.<sup id="cite_ref-93" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-93">[93]</a></sup> Punk retained his title in a Triple Threat match against both Edge and Hardy eight days later on the June 15 <i>Raw</i>.<sup id="cite_ref-94" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-94">[94]</a></sup> At <a href="/w/index.php?title=WWE_The_Bash&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WWE The Bash (page does not exist)">The Bash</a> in Sacramento, California, Punk lost to Hardy by disqualification after kicking the referee after being afflicted with a <a href="/w/index.php?title=Kayfabe&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Kayfabe (page does not exist)">storyline</a> eye injury, claiming he could not see the referee, but because titles do not change hands on a disqualification, Punk retained the championship. Hardy called Punk into question about his eye injury, believing he had been feigning it, leading Punk to turn <a href="/wiki/Heel_(professional_wrestling)" title="Heel (professional wrestling)">heel</a>, claiming to be the moral superior of those who support Hardy due to his drug-free lifestyle.<sup id="cite_ref-95" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-95">[95]</a></sup> At <a href="/w/index.php?title=Night_of_Champions_(2009)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Night of Champions (2009) (page does not exist)">Night of Champions</a>, Punk lost the championship to Hardy.<sup id="cite_ref-96" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-96">[96]</a></sup> Their feud continued through <a href="/w/index.php?title=SummerSlam_(2009)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="SummerSlam (2009) (page does not exist)">SummerSlam</a>, where Punk regained the title in a <a href="/wiki/Tables,_Ladders,_and_Chairs_match" title="Tables, Ladders, and Chairs match">Tables, Ladders, and Chairs match</a>; afterward, Punk was attacked by <a href="/wiki/The_Undertaker" title="The Undertaker">The Undertaker</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-97" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-97">[97]</a></sup> On the August 28 <i>Friday Night SmackDown</i>, Punk concluded his program with Hardy and achieved his <a href="/w/index.php?title=Professional_wrestling_booker&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Professional wrestling booker (page does not exist)">booked</a> goal of excising him from WWE, defeating Hardy in a <a href="/wiki/Steel_cage_match" title="Steel cage match" class="mw-redirect">steel cage match</a> wherein <a href="/w/index.php?title=Loser_Leaves_Town_match&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Loser Leaves Town match (page does not exist)">the loser agreed to leave the company</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-98" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-98">[98]</a></sup> This earned Punk a second Slammy that December, for <a href="/w/index.php?title=Slammy_Award&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Slammy Award (page does not exist)">2009's</a> "Shocker of the Year".<sup id="cite_ref-Slammy2_99-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Slammy2-99">[99]</a></sup>
</p><p>At <a href="/w/index.php?title=WWE_Breaking_Point&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WWE Breaking Point (page does not exist)">Breaking Point</a> Punk defeated The Undertaker in a <a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_match_types#Variations_of_singles_matches" title="Professional wrestling match types">submission match</a> to retain the World Heavyweight Championship. Undertaker originally won the match with his <a href="/w/index.php?title=Gogoplata&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Gogoplata (page does not exist)">Hell's Gate</a> submission hold. <a href="/w/index.php?title=Professional_wrestling_authority_figures&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Professional wrestling authority figures (page does not exist)">SmackDown general manager</a> <a href="/wiki/Theodore_Long" title="Theodore Long">Theodore Long</a> restarted the match after stating that the ban that former general manager <a href="/w/index.php?title=Vickie_Guerrero&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Vickie Guerrero (page does not exist)">Vickie Guerrero</a> had placed on the move was still in effect. Punk won the match with his <a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_holds#Anaconda_vise" title="Professional wrestling holds">Anaconda Vise</a> when referee <a href="/wiki/Scott_Armstrong_(wrestler)" title="Scott Armstrong (wrestler)">Scott Armstrong</a> called for the bell despite Undertaker never submitting (reminiscent to the <a href="/wiki/Montreal_Screwjob" title="Montreal Screwjob">Montreal Screwjob</a>, which took place in the same venue in 1997).<sup id="cite_ref-100" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-100">[100]</a></sup> The feud between the two continued and at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Hell_in_a_Cell_(2009)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Hell in a Cell (2009) (page does not exist)">the Hell in a Cell PPV</a>, Punk lost the World Heavyweight Championship to The Undertaker in a <a href="/wiki/Hell_in_a_Cell" title="Hell in a Cell">Hell in a Cell</a> match.<sup id="cite_ref-101" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-101">[101]</a></sup> He lost two subsequent rematches against The Undertaker on Smackdown and in a Fatal Four Way match at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Bragging_Rights_(2009)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Bragging Rights (2009) (page does not exist)">Bragging Rights</a> also involving Batista and <a href="/wiki/Rey_Mysterio" title="Rey Mysterio">Rey Mysterio</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-102" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-102">[102]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-103" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-103">[103]</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Straight_Edge_Society_and_New_Nexus_.282009.E2.80.932011.29">Straight Edge Society and New Nexus (2009–2011)</span></h4>
<p><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rellink&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rellink (page does not exist)">Template:Rellink</a>
His character took on a more sinister direction on the November 27 <i>SmackDown</i> when he revealed that he had converted <a href="/w/index.php?title=Drew_Hankinson&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Drew Hankinson (page does not exist)">Luke Gallows</a>, who had previously been portrayed as the mentally incompetent wrestler Festus, to the straight-edge lifestyle which had rid him of his mental troubles.<sup id="cite_ref-104" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-104">[104]</a></sup> Continuing to espouse his straight-edge philosophy, Punk began to present himself as a cult-like <a href="/wiki/Salvation" title="Salvation">savior</a> to the crowd, growing the hair on his head, face and chest in an allusion to Jesus.<sup id="cite_ref-saviour_105-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-saviour-105">[105]</a></sup> Through January 2010, Punk began to convert <a href="/wiki/Plant_(professional_wrestling)" title="Plant (professional wrestling)" class="mw-redirect">planted</a> members of the audience to a straight-edge lifestyle, making them take a pledge of allegiance to him and shaving their head as a sign of renewal and devotion.<sup id="cite_ref-106" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-106">[106]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-107" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-107">[107]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-SD-01222010_108-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SD-01222010-108">[108]</a></sup> After converting many people who were not seen again, convert <a href="/w/index.php?title=Serena_Deeb&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Serena Deeb (page does not exist)">Serena</a> began accompanying Punk and Gallows to form the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Straight_Edge_Society&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Straight Edge Society (page does not exist)">Straight Edge Society</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-SD-01222010_108-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SD-01222010-108">[108]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-109" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-109">[109]</a></sup> As well as leading this alliance, Punk was also the mentor of <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=WWE_NXT&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WWE NXT (page does not exist)">WWE NXT</a></i> rookie <a href="/w/index.php?title=Darren_Young_(wrestler)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Darren Young (wrestler) (page does not exist)">Darren Young</a> who flirted with the idea of becoming straight-edge before refusing just before his head was to be shaved.<sup id="cite_ref-110" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-110">[110]</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:182px;"><a href="/wiki/File:WWE_SES_Stable.jpg" title="File:WWE SES Stable.jpg">File:WWE SES Stable.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><a href="/w/index.php?title=Straight_Edge_Society&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Straight Edge Society (page does not exist)">Straight Edge Society</a>: <a href="/w/index.php?title=Serena_Deeb&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Serena Deeb (page does not exist)">Serena</a>, Punk and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Drew_Hankinson&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Drew Hankinson (page does not exist)">Luke Gallows</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>Punk continued to show messianic traits, frequently giving sermons including during the annual <a href="/wiki/Royal_Rumble#Match" title="Royal Rumble">Royal Rumble match</a> as well as during an <a href="/wiki/Elimination_Chamber" title="Elimination Chamber">Elimination Chamber</a> match at both of the eponymous pay-per-views.<sup id="cite_ref-111" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-111">[111]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-112" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-112">[112]</a></sup> In the Chamber match, he was eliminated by Rey Mysterio, whom he had feuding with leading into the PPV. Tensions escalated as Mysterio prevented him from winning a Money in the Bank qualifying match, causing Punk to interrupt Mysterio's celebration of his daughter's ninth birthday.<sup id="cite_ref-113" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-113">[113]</a></sup> Mysterio challenged Punk to a Street Fight at <a href="/w/index.php?title=WrestleMania_XXVI&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WrestleMania XXVI (page does not exist)">WrestleMania XXVI</a> but lost to Gallows. Punk added the stipulation that if Rey lost, he would join the Society.<sup id="cite_ref-114" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-114">[114]</a></sup> At WrestleMania, Punk lost to Mysterio<sup id="cite_ref-115" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-115">[115]</a></sup> sparking a rematch at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Extreme_Rules_(2010)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Extreme Rules (2010) (page does not exist)">Extreme Rules</a> where Punk would have to shave his head, like his disciples, if he lost. Punk won this match after interference from a fourth member of the Society who kept his face covered.<sup id="cite_ref-116" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-116">[116]</a></sup> At <a href="/w/index.php?title=Over_the_Limit_(2010)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Over the Limit (2010) (page does not exist)">Over The Limit</a>, a third and final match was booked with both stipulations reactivated. In the match Punk lost and was subsequently shaved bald.<sup id="cite_ref-117" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-117">[117]</a></sup>
</p><p>Embarrassed by being shaved bald as he considered himself always pure unlike his followers, Punk appeared on the following <i>SmackDown</i>, May 29, wearing a mask to hide his baldness.<sup id="cite_ref-118" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-118">[118]</a></sup> At <a href="/w/index.php?title=WWE_Fatal_4-Way&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WWE Fatal 4-Way (page does not exist)">Fatal 4-Way</a>, Punk challenged for the World Heavyweight Championship against Mysterio, The <a href="/wiki/Big_Show" title="Big Show">Big Show</a> and the champion <a href="/w/index.php?title=Jack_Swagger&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Jack Swagger (page does not exist)">Jack Swagger</a>, but was unsuccessful when he was attacked by <a href="/wiki/Kane_(wrestler)" title="Kane (wrestler)">Kane</a>, who was accusing various people of attacking The Undertaker.<sup id="cite_ref-119" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-119">[119]</a></sup> On July 16's <i>SmackDown</i>, Punk was finally unmasked by Big Show while healing from an arm injury.<sup id="cite_ref-120" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-120">[120]</a></sup> The following week Show also unmasked the anonymous member of the Straight Edge Society who was revealed to be <a href="/wiki/Adam_Birch" title="Adam Birch">Joey Mercury</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-121" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-121">[121]</a></sup> This led to a handicap match at <a href="/w/index.php?title=SummerSlam_(2010)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="SummerSlam (2010) (page does not exist)">SummerSlam</a> where Show defeated the entire Society after Punk abandoned his teammates.<sup id="cite_ref-122" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-122">[122]</a></sup> Show also beat Punk in a singles match at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Night_of_Champions_(2010)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Night of Champions (2010) (page does not exist)">Night of Champions</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-123" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-123">[123]</a></sup> Following this Serena was released from WWE<sup id="cite_ref-124" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-124">[124]</a></sup> while Mercury became injured,<sup id="cite_ref-125" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-125">[125]</a></sup> severely thinning the Society. Gallows began showing signs of dissension too, and Punk defeated him on <i>SmackDown</i>, airing September 24, ending the group.<sup id="cite_ref-126" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-126">[126]</a></sup>
</p>
