<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:182px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Finalnexus.jpg" title="File:Finalnexus.jpg">File:Finalnexus.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">Punk as leader of the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Nexus_(professional_wrestling)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Nexus (professional wrestling) (page does not exist)">New Nexus</a>, accompanied by <a href="/w/index.php?title=David_Otunga&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="David Otunga (page does not exist)">Otunga</a> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Michael_McGillicutty&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Michael McGillicutty (page does not exist)">McGillcutty</a> while confronting <a href="/wiki/Shawn_Michaels" title="Shawn Michaels">Shawn Michaels</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>Punk was traded back to the Raw brand on October 11 after being swapped with Edge. He took part in the interbrand tag team match at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Bragging_Rights_(2010)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Bragging Rights (2010) (page does not exist)">Bragging Rights</a> after injuring <a href="/w/index.php?title=Evan_Bourne&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Evan Bourne (page does not exist)">Evan Bourne</a> to win a place,<sup id="cite_ref-127" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-127">[127]</a></sup> but the team lost. It was reported later that he was suffering with a hip injury that would stop him from competing.<sup id="cite_ref-128" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-128">[128]</a></sup> To keep a presence on television, he began commentating on <i>Raw</i> from November 22,<sup id="cite_ref-129" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-129">[129]</a></sup> having already commentated one <i>NXT</i>. During his commentary, he criticized John Cena for his actions against The Nexus. Sometimes he favored heel wrestlers over face wrestlers. At the end of December, Punk left the commentary team after assaulting John Cena on <i>Raw</i><sup id="cite_ref-130" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-130">[130]</a></sup> and <i>SmackDown</i><sup id="cite_ref-131" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-131">[131]</a></sup> with a chair. Punk later revealed that his motives for the attacks were that he had joined and assumed control of The Nexus.<sup id="cite_ref-132" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-132">[132]</a></sup> He then used the group to attack Randy Orton, blaming him for prematurely ending Punk's first World Heavyweight Championship reign in 2008; this led to a <a href="/w/index.php?title=WrestleMania_XXVII&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WrestleMania XXVII (page does not exist)">WrestleMania XXVII</a> match<sup id="cite_ref-133" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-133">[133]</a></sup> and a Last Man Standing match at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Extreme_Rules_(2011)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Extreme Rules (2011) (page does not exist)">Extreme Rules</a> both of which Punk lost.<sup id="cite_ref-134" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-134">[134]</a></sup> Punk then spent the next few months involved in filler feuds, often teaming with fellow Nexus members.
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="WWE_Champion_.282011.E2.80.932013.29">WWE Champion (2011–2013)</span></h4>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:132px;"><a href="/wiki/File:CM_Punk_on_ring_apron.jpg" title="File:CM Punk on ring apron.jpg">File:CM Punk on ring apron.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">Punk in his second reign as <a href="/w/index.php?title=WWE_Championship&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WWE Championship (page does not exist)">WWE Champion</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>In June, after pinning WWE Champion John Cena on <i>Raw</i>,<sup id="cite_ref-135" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-135">[135]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Rey_Mysterio" title="Rey Mysterio">Rey Mysterio</a> at <a href="/w/index.php?title=WWE_Capitol_Punishment&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WWE Capitol Punishment (page does not exist)">Capitol Punishment</a><sup id="cite_ref-136" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-136">[136]</a></sup> and finally <a href="/w/index.php?title=Alberto_Del_Rio&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Alberto Del Rio (page does not exist)">Alberto Del Rio</a> again in a contendership match (which included Mysterio) all within one week, Punk revealed his contract would expire at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Money_in_the_Bank_(2011)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Money in the Bank (2011) (page does not exist)">Money in the Bank</a> and vowed to leave the company with the <a href="/w/index.php?title=WWE_Championship&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WWE Championship (page does not exist)">WWE Championship</a>; some of his speeches and mannerisms echoed his final months with Ring of Honor. After making a scathing on-air speech concerning the way in which WWE is run and its owner <a href="/wiki/Vince_McMahon" title="Vince McMahon">Vince McMahon</a>, he was given a storyline suspension from televised WWE events<sup id="cite_ref-World_Wrestling_Entertainment_137-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-World_Wrestling_Entertainment-137">[137]</a></sup> but was reinstated the following week on Cena's insistence.<sup id="cite_ref-James_Wortman_138-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-James_Wortman-138">[138]</a></sup> Upon his return, Punk ceased to appear with the remaining members of Nexus and the group quietly dissolved that month.<sup id="cite_ref-139" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-139">[139]</a></sup> This helped transition him from a <a href="/wiki/Heel_(professional_wrestling)" title="Heel (professional wrestling)">villainous</a> character back to being a <a href="/wiki/Face_(professional_wrestling)" title="Face (professional wrestling)">fan-favorite</a>. Two weeks later, at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Money_in_the_Bank_(2011)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Money in the Bank (2011) (page does not exist)">Money in the Bank</a>, CM Punk defeated John Cena to become the WWE Champion on his final night under contract with WWE.<sup id="cite_ref-James_Wortman_138-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-James_Wortman-138">[138]</a></sup>
</p><p>On July 21, Punk made a surprise appearance at a joint WWE-<a href="/wiki/Mattel" title="Mattel">Mattel</a> panel at the <a href="/wiki/San_Diego_Comic_Con" title="San Diego Comic Con" class="mw-redirect">San Diego Comic Con</a>, to mock new Chief Operating Officer Triple H and offer WWE Championship tournament finalist Rey Mysterio a match for his WWE Championship, as long as it was in Punk's hometown, Chicago.<sup id="cite_ref-ComicCon1_140-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ComicCon1-140">[140]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-ComicCon2_141-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ComicCon2-141">[141]</a></sup> Punk appeared at July 23's All American Wrestling show, showing respect to <a href="/w/index.php?title=Gregory_Iron&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Gregory Iron (page does not exist)">Gregory Iron</a>, a wrestler with <a href="/wiki/Cerebral_palsy" title="Cerebral palsy">cerebral palsy</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-142" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-142">[142]</a></sup> Mysterio won the WWE Championship tournament on the July 25 <i>Raw</i>, only to lose it to Cena later that night. After Cena's victory, Punk returned to <i>Raw</i> and <a href="http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/upstage#Verb" class="extiw" title="wiktionary:upstage">upstaged</a> the new WWE Champion's victory celebration while also entering into a title dispute. Triple H later upheld both Punk and Cena's claims to the WWE Championship as legitimate and schedule the two to a match at <a href="/w/index.php?title=SummerSlam_(2011)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="SummerSlam (2011) (page does not exist)">SummerSlam</a> to decide the undisputed WWE Champion.<sup id="cite_ref-143" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-143">[143]</a></sup> Punk won, but lost the title minutes later to Alberto Del Rio, who had cashed in his Money in the Bank contract after <a href="/wiki/Kevin_Nash" title="Kevin Nash">Kevin Nash</a> attacked Punk.<sup id="cite_ref-144" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-144">[144]</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:132px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Punk_%26_Laurinaitis.jpg" title="File:Punk &amp; Laurinaitis.jpg">File:Punk &amp; Laurinaitis.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">Punk, during his second <a href="/w/index.php?title=WWE_Championship&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WWE Championship (page does not exist)">WWE Championship</a> reign, being watched by <a href="/wiki/John_Laurinaitis" title="John Laurinaitis">John Laurinaitis</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>The night after SummerSlam, Punk accused Nash of conspiring with Triple H to keep Punk away from the WWE Championship.<sup id="cite_ref-145" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-145">[145]</a></sup> After repeated confrontations Nash and Punk demanded to face each other at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Night_of_Champions_(2011)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Night of Champions (2011) (page does not exist)">Night of Champions</a>, to which Triple H acquiesced. However, after CM Punk's repeated verbal attacks towards him and his wife <a href="/wiki/Stephanie_McMahon" title="Stephanie McMahon">Stephanie McMahon</a>, Triple H booked himself to replace Nash.<sup id="cite_ref-146" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-146">[146]</a></sup> At Night of Champions, Punk lost a <a href="/w/index.php?title=No_Disqualification_match&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="No Disqualification match (page does not exist)">No Disqualification match</a> after Nash, The Miz, and <a href="/wiki/Ron_Killings" title="Ron Killings">R-Truth</a> attacked both men.<sup id="cite_ref-147" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-147">[147]</a></sup> Miz and Truth also attacked Punk at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Hell_in_a_Cell_(2011)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Hell in a Cell (2011) (page does not exist)">Hell in a Cell</a> after he lost a WWE Championship triple threat match.<sup id="cite_ref-148" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-148">[148]</a></sup> He attempted to avenge this by teaming with Triple H against Miz and Truth at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Vengeance_(2011)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Vengeance (2011) (page does not exist)">Vengeance</a>, but lost again due to Nash attacking Triple H.<sup id="cite_ref-149" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-149">[149]</a></sup> This helped transition Punk's anti-establishment voice from Triple H to <a href="/wiki/John_Laurinaitis" title="John Laurinaitis">John Laurinaitis</a>, who became the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Professional_wrestling_authority_figures&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Professional wrestling authority figures (page does not exist)">interim Raw general manager</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-150" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-150">[150]</a></sup> CM Punk balked at Laurinaitis' promotion and verbally attacked him as a dull <a href="/w/index.php?title=Sycophant&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Sycophant (page does not exist)">yes man</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-151" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-151">[151]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-152" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-152">[152]</a></sup>
</p><p>On October 31, CM Punk strong-armed his way into a match with Del Rio at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Survivor_Series_(2011)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Survivor Series (2011) (page does not exist)">Survivor Series</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-153" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-153">[153]</a></sup> where he regained the WWE Championship by way of submission with the Anaconda Vise.<sup id="cite_ref-154" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-154">[154]</a></sup> He went on to defend the title through the end of the year, retaining in a rematch with Del Rio on the November 28 <i>Raw</i><sup id="cite_ref-155" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-155">[155]</a></sup> and against both Del Rio and The Miz in a <a href="/wiki/Tables,_Ladders,_and_Chairs_match" title="Tables, Ladders, and Chairs match">triple threat TLC match</a> at <a href="/w/index.php?title=TLC:_Tables,_Ladders_%26_Chairs_(2011)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="TLC: Tables, Ladders &amp; Chairs (2011) (page does not exist)">TLC: Tables, Ladders &amp; Chairs</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-156" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-156">[156]</a></sup> On the December 26 <i>Raw</i>, CM Punk was defeated by <a href="/w/index.php?title=Dolph_Ziggler&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Dolph Ziggler (page does not exist)">Dolph Ziggler</a> in a <a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_match_types#Gauntlet_match" title="Professional wrestling match types">gauntlet match</a>; as a result Ziggler became the number one contender to the WWE championship. Had he been successful, Punk would have earned the right to face Laurinaitis in a match.<sup id="cite_ref-157" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-157">[157]</a></sup> The following <i>Raw</i>, Punk was defeated by Ziggler via countout following interference from Laurinaitis; retaining the championship as a result.<sup id="cite_ref-158" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-158">[158]</a></sup> Intermeddling from Laurinaitis caused Punk to lose to Ziggler throughout January<sup id="cite_ref-159" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-159">[159]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-JohnnyAce_160-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-JohnnyAce-160">[160]</a></sup> which ultimately led to Punk attacking Laurinaitis in retaliation.<sup id="cite_ref-JohnnyAce_160-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-JohnnyAce-160">[160]</a></sup> At the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Royal_Rumble_(2012)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Royal Rumble (2012) (page does not exist)">Royal Rumble</a> event, CM Punk successfully defended his title against Ziggler, despite Laurinaitis acting as the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Referee_(professional_wrestling)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Referee (professional wrestling) (page does not exist)">outside enforcer</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-161" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-161">[161]</a></sup>
</p><p>On the January 30 <i>Raw</i>, <a href="/wiki/Chris_Jericho" title="Chris Jericho">Chris Jericho</a> attacked Punk and <a href="/wiki/Daniel_Bryan" title="Daniel Bryan">Daniel Bryan</a> during their Champion vs. Champion match, giving Bryan the win.<sup id="cite_ref-162" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-162">[162]</a></sup> The following week, Jericho explained his actions by dismissing the WWE roster as imitations of himself and singling out Punk for claiming he was the best in the world, a moniker Jericho used the last time he was in WWE.<sup id="cite_ref-163" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-163">[163]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-164" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-164">[164]</a></sup> Their rivalry continued through <a href="/w/index.php?title=Elimination_Chamber_(2012)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Elimination Chamber (2012) (page does not exist)">Elimination Chamber</a> where Punk retained the WWE Championship in the namesake structure; while four competitors were eliminated, Jericho was unable to continue the match after being kicked out of the chamber by Punk, causing temporary injury.<sup id="cite_ref-165" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-165">[165]</a></sup> The following night on <i>Raw</i>, Jericho earned a match against Punk at <a href="/w/index.php?title=WrestleMania_XXVIII&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WrestleMania XXVIII (page does not exist)">WrestleMania XXVIII</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-Raw_SuperShow_2.2F20.2F12_Results_166-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Raw_SuperShow_2.2F20.2F12_Results-166">[166]</a></sup> and in a bid to psychologically unsettle him, he revealed Punk's father was an alcoholic and alleged that his sister was a drug addict, asserting that Punk's <a href="/w/index.php?title=Straight_edge&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Straight edge (page does not exist)">straight edge</a> philosophy was paranoia to avoid the same vices and vowing to make Punk turn to alcohol by winning the title from him.<sup id="cite_ref-167" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-167">[167]</a></sup> John Laurinaitis added the stipulation that the WWE Championship could change hands via disqualification, which led to Jericho inciting Punk into using a weapon, but Punk resisted and retained the title.<sup id="cite_ref-168" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-168">[168]</a></sup> On the April 2 and 9 episodes of <i>Raw SuperShow</i>, Punk retained the WWE Championship against <a href="/wiki/Mark_Henry" title="Mark Henry">Mark Henry</a> after losing to him via count-out and disqualification. Following both matches, Jericho attacked Punk and doused him with alcohol.<sup id="cite_ref-169" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-169">[169]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-170" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-170">[170]</a></sup> On the April 16 <i>Raw SuperShow</i>, Punk pinned Henry in a no disqualification, no countout match to retain his title.<sup id="cite_ref-171" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-171">[171]</a></sup> After repeated altercations, the feud between Jericho and Punk culminated in a <a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_match_types#Hardcore-based_variations" title="Professional wrestling match types">Chicago Street Fight</a> at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Extreme_Rules_(2012)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Extreme Rules (2012) (page does not exist)">Extreme Rules</a> where Punk defeated Jericho to retain the WWE Championship.<sup id="cite_ref-172" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-172">[172]</a></sup>
</p><p>Punk began a rivalry with Daniel Bryan at the May event <a href="/w/index.php?title=Over_the_Limit_(2012)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Over the Limit (2012) (page does not exist)">Over the Limit</a>, retaining the title after reversing Bryan's submission hold the <a href="/wiki/Daniel_Bryan#In_wrestling" title="Daniel Bryan"><i>"Yes!" Lock</i></a> into a pinning combination, however, replays showed Punk visibly tapping out moments after the finish of the match.<sup id="cite_ref-173" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-173">[173]</a></sup> Shortly before Over the Limit, Bryan interfered in a non-title match between Punk and Kane to frame Punk for attacking Kane with a steel chair, beginning a three-way rivalry.<sup id="cite_ref-174" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-174">[174]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-175" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-175">[175]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-176" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-176">[176]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-177" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-177">[177]</a></sup> On the June 1 <i>SmackDown</i>, a WWE Championship match between Punk and Kane ended in a double disqualification after Bryan attacked both men.<sup id="cite_ref-178" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-178">[178]</a></sup> Meanwhile, Bryan's jilted ex-girlfriend <a href="/w/index.php?title=AJ_Lee&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="AJ Lee (page does not exist)">AJ</a> turned her affections to both Punk and Kane.<sup id="cite_ref-Three_179-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Three-179">[179]</a></sup> This feud culminated in a triple threat match at <a href="/w/index.php?title=No_Way_Out_(2012)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="No Way Out (2012) (page does not exist)">No Way Out</a>, where Punk managed to retain the title after AJ distracted Kane.<sup id="cite_ref-180" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-180">[180]</a></sup> At <a href="/w/index.php?title=Money_in_the_Bank_(2012)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Money in the Bank (2012) (page does not exist)">Money in the Bank</a>, Punk successfully defended the WWE Championship against Bryan in a No Disqualification match with AJ as <a href="/w/index.php?title=Referee_(professional_wrestling)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Referee (professional wrestling) (page does not exist)">special guest referee</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-181" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-181">[181]</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:182px;"><a href="/wiki/File:CM_Punk_and_Paul_Heyman.jpg" title="File:CM Punk and Paul Heyman.jpg">File:CM Punk and Paul Heyman.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">An injured Punk accompanied by Paul Heyman on <i>Raw</i> in December 2012.</div></div></div>
<p>On July 23 at <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=WWE_Raw_1000&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WWE Raw 1000 (page does not exist)">Raw 1000</a></i>, Punk defended his title against <a href="/w/index.php?title=Money_in_the_Bank_ladder_match&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Money in the Bank ladder match (page does not exist)">Money in the Bank</a> winner John Cena and lost by disqualification after interference from Big Show.<sup id="cite_ref-182" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-182">[182]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-183" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-183">[183]</a></sup> When the night's special guest <a href="/wiki/Dwayne_Johnson" title="Dwayne Johnson">The Rock</a> – who had interrupted Punk earlier to announce he would wrestle for the WWE Championship at the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Royal_Rumble_(2013)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Royal Rumble (2013) (page does not exist)">Royal Rumble</a> – intervened, Punk attacked him, turning heel.<sup id="cite_ref-184" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-184">[184]</a></sup> The following week, Punk justified his actions, claiming he was tired of people like Cena and Rock overshadowing him when the WWE champion should be the focus of the company; Punk asserted himself further soon after by disrupting a number one contender's match between Cena and Big Show.<sup id="cite_ref-PunkCenaShow_185-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PunkCenaShow-185">[185]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-186" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-186">[186]</a></sup> As a result, both men were entered into the title match against Punk at <a href="/w/index.php?title=SummerSlam_(2012)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="SummerSlam (2012) (page does not exist)">SummerSlam</a> where he successfully retained the WWE Championship.<sup id="cite_ref-187" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-187">[187]</a></sup> In the following weeks, Punk demanded respect from people like AJ Lee, <a href="/wiki/Jerry_Lawler" title="Jerry Lawler">Jerry Lawler</a> and <a href="/wiki/Bret_Hart" title="Bret Hart">Bret Hart</a> and eventually aligned with <a href="/wiki/Paul_Heyman" title="Paul Heyman">Paul Heyman</a> in his feud with Cena.<sup id="cite_ref-188" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-188">[188]</a></sup> At <a href="/w/index.php?title=Night_of_Champions_(2012)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Night of Champions (2012) (page does not exist)">Night of Champions</a>, Punk retained the WWE Championship after he fought Cena to a draw.<sup id="cite_ref-189" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-189">[189]</a></sup> Punk continued to feud with Cena, despite the latter's arm injury,<sup id="cite_ref-190" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-190">[190]</a></sup> rejecting the requests of <a href="/wiki/Mick_Foley" title="Mick Foley">Mick Foley</a> and <a href="/wiki/Jim_Ross" title="Jim Ross">Jim Ross</a> to pick him as his <a href="/w/index.php?title=Hell_in_a_Cell_(2012)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Hell in a Cell (2012) (page does not exist)">Hell in a Cell</a> opponent and leading to a brawl with WWE chairman Vince McMahon.<sup id="cite_ref-191" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-191">[191]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-192" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-192">[192]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-193" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-193">[193]</a></sup> Cena was eventually pulled from the title match at Hell in a Cell, and replaced by <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ryback_(wrestler)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ryback (wrestler) (page does not exist)">Ryback</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-194" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-194">[194]</a></sup> On October 28 at the pay-per-view, Punk, with help from referee <a href="/w/index.php?title=Brad_Maddox&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Brad Maddox (page does not exist)">Brad Maddox</a>, defeated Ryback in a Hell in a Cell match to retain the WWE Championship.<sup id="cite_ref-195" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-195">[195]</a></sup> The next night on <i>Raw</i>, a furious Mick Foley confronted Punk for refusing to pick John Cena as his Hell in a Cell opponent. This led to the two agreeing to meet at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Survivor_Series_(2012)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Survivor Series (2012) (page does not exist)">Survivor Series</a> in a traditional five-on-five elimination tag team match with Punk choosing Alberto Del Rio, Cody Rhodes, <a href="/wiki/Damien_Sandow" title="Damien Sandow">Damien Sandow</a>, and The Miz for his own team.<sup id="cite_ref-196" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-196">[196]</a></sup> The next week, Punk was replaced as captain by Dolph Ziggler, and booked in a Triple Threat WWE Championship match against John Cena and Ryback instead by Mr. McMahon.<sup id="cite_ref-197" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-197">[197]</a></sup> On November 18 at the pay-per-view, Punk won the match by pinning Cena, following interference from the debuting faction called <a href="/w/index.php?title=The_Shield_(professional_wrestling)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="The Shield (professional wrestling) (page does not exist)">The Shield</a>, composed of <a href="/w/index.php?title=Jon_Moxley&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Jon Moxley (page does not exist)">Dean Ambrose</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Tyler_Black&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Tyler Black (page does not exist)">Seth Rollins</a>, and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Joe_Anoa%27i&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Joe Anoa'i (page does not exist)">Roman Reigns</a>, allowing him to retain the WWE Championship and hold the championship for a full year.<sup id="cite_ref-198" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-198">[198]</a></sup> On December 4, Punk underwent surgery to repair a partially torn <a href="/w/index.php?title=Meniscus_(anatomy)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Meniscus (anatomy) (page does not exist)">meniscus</a>, removing him from his title match against Ryback at <a href="/w/index.php?title=TLC:_Tables,_Ladders_%26_Chairs_(2012)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="TLC: Tables, Ladders &amp; Chairs (2012) (page does not exist)">TLC: Tables, Ladders and Chairs</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-199" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-199">[199]</a></sup> Despite his injury, Punk became the longest reigning WWE Champion in the past 25 years on December 5, when he hit 381 days, surpassing John Cena's 380-day reign. Punk returned to in-ring action on the January 7, 2013 <i>Raw</i>, retaining the WWE Championship against Ryback in a Tables, Ladders, and Chairs match, following interference from The Shield.<sup id="cite_ref-200" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-200">[200]</a></sup>
</p><p>On January 27 at the Royal Rumble, Punk defended the WWE Championship against The Rock in a match with the stipulation that if The Shield interfered, Punk would be stripped of the title. Punk originally pinned The Rock to retain after The Shield put Rock through a table while the arena lights were out. Vince McMahon began to announce that Punk would be stripped of the title, but he instead restarted the match at The Rock's request. Punk quickly lost the match, ending his record-setting reign at 434 days.<sup id="cite_ref-201" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-201">[201]</a></sup> Punk received a title rematch with Rock on February 17 at the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Elimination_Chamber_(2013)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Elimination Chamber (2013) (page does not exist)">Elimination Chamber</a> event, with the stipulation that the Rock would lose the WWE Championship if he was disqualified or counted out, but Rock pinned Punk to retain the title.<sup id="cite_ref-202" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-202">[202]</a></sup> On the February 25 <i>Raw</i>, Punk faced Royal Rumble winner John Cena for his number one contendership to the WWE Championship, but was defeated.<sup id="cite_ref-203" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-203">[203]</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Various_feuds_.282013.E2.80.93present.29">Various feuds (2013–present)</span></h4>
<p>Punk set his sights on ending The Undertaker's WrestleMania streak on the March 4 <i>Raw</i>, in an effort to take something away from the fans, as they had taken the WWE title away from him. Punk subsequently defeated Big Show, Randy Orton, and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Sheamus&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Sheamus (page does not exist)">Sheamus</a> in a four-way match to earn the right to face Undertaker.<sup id="cite_ref-204" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-204">[204]</a></sup> After the real-life death of <a href="/wiki/Paul_Bearer" title="Paul Bearer">Paul Bearer</a> the following day, a storyline involving Punk regularly <a href="/w/index.php?title=Spite_(sentiment)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Spite (sentiment) (page does not exist)">spiting</a> The Undertaker through displays of flippancy and disrespect towards Bearer's death began.<sup id="cite_ref-205" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-205">[205]</a></sup> Punk interrupted The Undertaker's ceremony to honor Bearer on <i>Raw</i>, stealing his trademark urn and later using it to attack Kane, humiliate the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Brothers_of_Destruction&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Brothers of Destruction (page does not exist)">Brothers of Destruction</a>, and mock Bearer.<sup id="cite_ref-206" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-206">[206]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-207" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-207">[207]</a></sup> On April 7 at <a href="/w/index.php?title=WrestleMania_29&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WrestleMania 29 (page does not exist)">WrestleMania 29</a>, Punk was defeated by The Undertaker who, in the process, extended his streak to 21–0 and took back the urn.<sup id="cite_ref-208" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-208">[208]</a></sup> On the April 15 <i>Raw</i>, Punk addressed the crowd and after briefly recalling his historic championship reign, walked out of the arena.<sup id="cite_ref-209" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-209">[209]</a></sup>
</p><p>Punk returned at <a href="/w/index.php?title=WWE_Payback&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WWE Payback (page does not exist)">WWE Payback</a> on June 16, defeating Chris Jericho.<sup id="cite_ref-210" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-210">[210]</a></sup> The next night on <i>Raw</i>, Punk told Heyman to stay away from him during his matches. Later in the night, after Punk's win over World Heavyweight Champion Alberto Del Rio, <a href="/wiki/Brock_Lesnar" title="Brock Lesnar">Brock Lesnar</a> returned and executed an <i>F-5</i> on Punk.<sup id="cite_ref-211" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-211">[211]</a></sup> The next week on <i>Raw</i>, Heyman promised Punk that he did not send Lesnar to attack him, and that he still considered Punk his best friend, and claimed that any problem Punk and Lesnar had with each other was between them. Following that, Punk defeated <a href="/w/index.php?title=Darren_Young_(wrestler)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Darren Young (wrestler) (page does not exist)">Darren Young</a>; when Young and his tag team partner <a href="/w/index.php?title=Titus_O%27Neil&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Titus O'Neil (page does not exist)">Titus O'Neil</a> began attacking him, Heyman summoned his other client <a href="/w/index.php?title=Curtis_Axel&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Curtis Axel (page does not exist)">Curtis Axel</a> to help Punk fight them off, much to Punk's dismay.<sup id="cite_ref-212" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-212">[212]</a></sup> On the July 1 <i>Raw</i>, Punk claimed that he trusted Heyman but did not trust Axel. Punk and Axel faced O'Neil and Young in a tag team match, that saw Punk hit Young with the <i>Go To Sleep</i>, Axel tagging himself in, and pinning Young for the victory, causing more friction between Punk and Heyman.<sup id="cite_ref-213" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-213">[213]</a></sup> On July 14 at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Money_in_the_Bank_(2013)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Money in the Bank (2013) (page does not exist)">Money in the Bank</a>, Punk competed in the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Money_in_the_Bank_ladder_match&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Money in the Bank ladder match (page does not exist)">WWE Championship Money in the Bank ladder match</a>, but Heyman turned on him by hitting him with a ladder, costing him the match that was ultimately won by Randy Orton.<sup id="cite_ref-214" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-214">[214]</a></sup> The following night on <i>Raw</i>, Punk called out Heyman, who claimed that, without him, Punk was no longer the "Best in the World". He revealed that he did not believe that Punk could beat Lesnar, who then came out and hit the <i>F-5</i> on Punk onto the announce table.<sup id="cite_ref-215" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-215">[215]</a></sup> The following week on <i>Raw</i>, Punk challenged Lesnar to a match at <a href="/w/index.php?title=SummerSlam_(2013)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="SummerSlam (2013) (page does not exist)">SummerSlam</a>, which Heyman accepted on Lesnar's behalf.<sup id="cite_ref-216" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-216">[216]</a></sup> On the August 5 <i>Raw</i>, Punk wrestled Axel to a no-contest, after Heyman attacked him. Lesnar then came out and brawled with Punk, eventually getting the upper hand.<sup id="cite_ref-217" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-217">[217]</a></sup> Punk got revenge the next week by attacking Lesnar with a camera and a steel chair, after Heyman tried to change the scheduled match between Punk and himself to a handicap match involving Lesnar. He then delivered a <i>Go To Sleep</i> to Axel, who had interfered while Punk was chasing Heyman.<sup id="cite_ref-218" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-218">[218]</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:182px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Punk_and_Bryan.jpg" title="File:Punk and Bryan.jpg">File:Punk and Bryan.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">Punk (left) allied himself with <a href="/wiki/Daniel_Bryan" title="Daniel Bryan">Daniel Bryan</a> heading into <a href="/w/index.php?title=Survivor_Series_(2013)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Survivor Series (2013) (page does not exist)">Survivor Series</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>Six days later, at <a href="/w/index.php?title=SummerSlam_(2013)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="SummerSlam (2013) (page does not exist)">SummerSlam</a>, Punk lost to Lesnar in a No Disqualification match, after interference by Heyman.<sup id="cite_ref-219" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-219">[219]</a></sup> On the next <i>Raw</i>, Punk had the chance to again become a "Paul Heyman guy", but declined by attacking Axel. The next week, Punk defeated Axel before being assaulted by him and Heyman. Punk was then scheduled to face Axel and Heyman in a handicap elimination match at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Night_of_Champions_(2013)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Night of Champions (2013) (page does not exist)">Night Of Champions</a>, later adding a No Disqualification to the stipulation. During the match, Punk tapped Axel out, leaving only Heyman left to deal with, but in the process of attacking Heyman, Ryback attacked Punk and placed Heyman on top of Punk for the pin. At <a href="/w/index.php?title=WWE_Battleground&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WWE Battleground (page does not exist)">Battleground</a>, Punk defeated Ryback after executing a low blow, while the referee was distracted by Heyman attempting to interfere in the match. On the October 14 episode of <i>Raw</i>, Punk defeated Axel in a <a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_match_types#Beat_the_Clock_challenge_match" title="Professional wrestling match types">Beat a Clock challenge match</a> to determine the stipulation for his rematch with Ryback at the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Hell_in_a_Cell_(2013)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Hell in a Cell (2013) (page does not exist)">Hell in a Cell</a> pay-per-view. He announced that his match would a be two-on-one <a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_match_types#Handicap_match" title="Professional wrestling match types">handicap match</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Hell_in_a_Cell" title="Hell in a Cell">Hell in a Cell</a>, in which he would face Paul Heyman and Ryback.<sup id="cite_ref-220" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-220">[220]</a></sup> On October 27, at Hell in a Cell, Punk defeated Ryback and Paul Heyman. Punk faced Ryback again in a Street Fight match the following night on <i>Raw</i>, defeating Ryback by submission, thus ending their feud. After the match, he was attacked by <a href="/w/index.php?title=The_Wyatt_Family&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="The Wyatt Family (page does not exist)">The Wyatt Family</a> (<a href="/w/index.php?title=Bray_Wyatt&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Bray Wyatt (page does not exist)">Bray Wyatt</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Luke_Harper&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Luke Harper (page does not exist)">Luke Harper</a> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Erick_Rowan&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Erick Rowan (page does not exist)">Erick Rowan</a>), starting a feud, and later formed an alliance with former rival <a href="/wiki/Daniel_Bryan" title="Daniel Bryan">Daniel Bryan</a>. At <a href="/w/index.php?title=Survivor_Series_(2013)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Survivor Series (2013) (page does not exist)">Survivor Series</a>, Punk and Bryan defeated Harper and Rowan in a tag team match.
</p><p>After Bryan was "abducted" by the Wyatt Family the following night on <i>Raw</i>, Punk was attacked by old allies The Shield (Dean Ambrose, Seth Rollins, and Roman Reigns). The following week on <i>Raw</i>, Kane announced that Punk would face The Shield in a 3-on-1 Handicap match at <a href="/w/index.php?title=TLC:_Tables,_Ladders_%26_Chairs_(2013)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="TLC: Tables, Ladders &amp; Chairs (2013) (page does not exist)">Tables, Ladders &amp; Chairs</a>, which Punk won after Reigns accidentally speared Ambrose. At the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Royal_Rumble_(2014)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Royal Rumble (2014) (page does not exist)">Royal Rumble</a>, Punk entered in at entrant #1. After having lasted until the final four, Kane, who was already eliminated earlier in the match by Punk, eliminated Punk from the outside.<sup id="cite_ref-http:.2F.2Fwww.wwe.com.2Fshows.2Froyalrumble.2F2014.2Froyal-rumble-match-26171285_221-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-http:.2F.2Fwww.wwe.com.2Fshows.2Froyalrumble.2F2014.2Froyal-rumble-match-26171285-221">[221]</a></sup>
</p><p>Punk did not appear on the <i>Raw</i> after the Rumble.<sup id="cite_ref-WalkoutTorch_222-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WalkoutTorch-222">[222]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-WalkOutIndy_223-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WalkOutIndy-223">[223]</a></sup> Despite being advertised for the <i>SmackDown</i> taping on Tuesday, he wasn't there either.<sup id="cite_ref-WalkoutTorch_222-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WalkoutTorch-222">[222]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-WalkOutIndy_223-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WalkOutIndy-223">[223]</a></sup> By Wednesday, WWE.com stopped advertising Punk for future events.<sup id="cite_ref-WalkoutTorch_222-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WalkoutTorch-222">[222]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-WalkOutIndy_223-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WalkOutIndy-223">[223]</a></sup> <i>The Wrestling Observer</i> reported Punk had legitimately left the event on Monday after telling <a href="/wiki/Vince_McMahon" title="Vince McMahon">Vince McMahon</a> he was "going home".<sup id="cite_ref-WalkoutTorch_222-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WalkoutTorch-222">[222]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-WalkOutIndy_223-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WalkOutIndy-223">[223]</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Character">Character</span></h2>
<p>A key part of Punk's gimmick emerges in the form of <a href="http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/iconoclastic" class="extiw" title="wikt:iconoclastic">iconoclasm</a> which can be shown in his disinclination to conform and penchant for challenging popular and accepted beliefs, traditions, and customs. A prime example, Punk has adopted his real-life following of the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Straight_edge&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Straight edge (page does not exist)">straight edge</a> movement as a major attribute of his professional wrestling character. The character utilizes different elements of Punk's personality and beliefs of the straight edge movement dependent on his antagonist/protagonist <a href="/w/index.php?title=Glossary_of_professional_wrestling_terms&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Glossary of professional wrestling terms (page does not exist)">alignment</a>. While portraying a crowd favorite, Punk's character tends to be that of Punk's normal personality,<sup id="cite_ref-punkshoot_8-13" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-punkshoot-8">[8]</a></sup> largely indifferent to others who drink <a href="/w/index.php?title=Alcoholic_beverage&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Alcoholic beverage (page does not exist)">alcohol</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Smoking&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Smoking (page does not exist)">smoke</a> tobacco, partake in <a href="/wiki/Recreational_drug_use" title="Recreational drug use">recreational drug use</a> or have <a href="/wiki/Promiscuity" title="Promiscuity">promiscuous</a> <a href="/wiki/Human_sexual_activity" title="Human sexual activity">sexual behavior</a>, but emphasizing the social discipline involved with <a href="/w/index.php?title=Abstinence&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Abstinence (page does not exist)">abstinence</a>. Conversely, his villainous personality tends to be that of one who is <a href="/wiki/Hardline_(subculture)" title="Hardline (subculture)">hardline</a> or <a href="/w/index.php?title=Straight_edge&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Straight edge (page does not exist)">militant straight edge</a>, exemplifying the elitist attitudes and superiority complexes—defined by Punk's common mantra during villainous-themed <a href="/wiki/Promos_(professional_wrestling)" title="Promos (professional wrestling)" class="mw-redirect">promos</a> that, because he is straight edge, he is "better than you".<sup id="cite_ref-punkshoot_8-14" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-punkshoot-8">[8]</a></sup> Punk performs the straight edge symbol of crossing his arms in an X formation while having the letter X written on the back of his hands, usually drawn on his wrist tape.
</p><p>Originally, the initials CM in his ring name represented the phrase "Chick Magnet", the name of the tag team he was in as a <a href="/wiki/Backyard_wrestling" title="Backyard wrestling">backyard wrestler</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-punkshoot_8-15" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-punkshoot-8">[8]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-jon_10-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-jon-10">[10]</a></sup> Punk, however, later changed CM into a <a href="/wiki/Pseudo-acronym" title="Pseudo-acronym" class="mw-redirect">pseudo-acronym</a>, declaring that it has no meaning,<sup id="cite_ref-wojick_13-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-wojick-13">[13]</a></sup> though when asked since he has taken to making up meanings that fit the initials, going so far as to make up long stories to explain the origins that do not match the actual origin story at all.<sup id="cite_ref-wojick_13-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-wojick-13">[13]</a></sup> Since beginning this practice, Punk has stated CM stands for "<a href="/w/index.php?title=Cookie_Monster&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Cookie Monster (page does not exist)">Cookie Monster</a>",<sup id="cite_ref-224" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-224">[224]</a></sup> "Cookie Master",<sup id="cite_ref-225" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-225">[225]</a></sup> "<a href="#In_wrestling">Crooked Moonsault</a>",<sup id="cite_ref-cagematchde_226-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cagematchde-226">[226]</a></sup> "<a href="/wiki/Chuck_Mosley" title="Chuck Mosley">Chuck Mosley</a>",<sup id="cite_ref-cagematchde_226-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cagematchde-226">[226]</a></sup> "<a href="/wiki/Mr._Burns" title="Mr. Burns">Charles Montgomery</a>",<sup id="cite_ref-jon_10-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-jon-10">[10]</a></sup> "<a href="/wiki/Charles_Manson" title="Charles Manson">Charles Manson</a>",<sup id="cite_ref-jon_10-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-jon-10">[10]</a></sup> "Chicago Made",<sup id="cite_ref-227" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-227">[227]</a></sup>  among others.
</p><p>During his entrance, Punk yells "It's clobberin' time!" The phrase is a reference to <a href="/w/index.php?title=New_York&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="New York (page does not exist)">New York</a> <a href="/wiki/Hardcore_punk" title="Hardcore punk">hardcore punk</a> band <a href="/wiki/Sick_of_It_All" title="Sick of It All">Sick of It All</a>, who wrote a song with the same name, and <a href="/wiki/Marvel_Comics" title="Marvel Comics">Marvel's</a> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Fictional_character&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Fictional character (page does not exist)">fictional character</a> <a href="/wiki/Thing_(comics)" title="Thing (comics)">The Thing</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-PunkMarvelInterview_228-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PunkMarvelInterview-228">[228]</a></sup>
</p><p>An integral part of Punk are the numerous <a href="/wiki/Tattoo" title="Tattoo">tattoos</a> that adorn his body, some of which have come to become symbols associated with Punk, as well as <a href="/wiki/Mantra" title="Mantra">mantras</a> and declarations that have been integrated into his gimmick. The tattoos as a whole, due to their large quantity and variety, have also become an attribute identifiable to Punk.<sup id="cite_ref-wwemag_229-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-wwemag-229">[229]</a></sup> The most important of the individual tattoos in Punk's character, whether through association, symbol, or mantra, are:
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:132px;"><a href="/wiki/File:CM_Punk_RAW_800.jpg" title="File:CM Punk RAW 800.jpg">File:CM Punk RAW 800.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">CM Punk at a <i>Raw</i> taping. Prominently visible are the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Pepsi_Globe&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Pepsi Globe (page does not exist)">Pepsi Globe</a> <a href="/wiki/Tattoo" title="Tattoo">tattoo</a> on his left shoulder, the "luck is for losers" <a href="/w/index.php?title=Sleeve_tattoo&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Sleeve tattoo (page does not exist)">sleeve tattoo</a> on his left arm, and the "straight edge" tattoo across his stomach.</div></div></div>
<ul>
<li>A <a href="/w/index.php?title=Pepsi_Globe&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Pepsi Globe (page does not exist)">Pepsi Globe</a> logo on his left shoulder that inspired the names of two of his <a href="#In_wrestling">signature moves</a>. It also became a symbol of Punk himself, who wore the logo on his ring gear in the independent circuit, as well as a slightly modified Pepsi logo being used as part of his <a href="/wiki/Jumbotron" title="Jumbotron">TitanTron</a> entrance video.<sup id="cite_ref-230" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-230">[230]</a></sup> Punk, a keen <a href="/wiki/Pepsi" title="Pepsi">Pepsi</a> drinker, chose to receive a Pepsi tattoo to emphasize his straight edge beliefs.<sup id="cite_ref-wojick_13-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-wojick-13">[13]</a></sup> The tattoo is also a reference to former <a href="/wiki/Minor_Threat" title="Minor Threat">Minor Threat</a> guitarist <a href="/wiki/Brian_Baker_(musician)" title="Brian Baker (musician)">Brian Baker</a>, who had a <a href="/wiki/Coca-Cola" title="Coca-Cola">Coca-Cola</a> tattoo and explained this by saying "I like Coca-Cola". When people inquire about Punk's Pepsi tattoo, he often replies "I like Pepsi" in a similar fashion.<sup id="cite_ref-punkshoot_8-16" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-punkshoot-8">[8]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>The words "Straight Edge" are spelled out on Punk's stomach. This is one of his oldest tattoos;<sup id="cite_ref-wwemag_229-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-wwemag-229">[229]</a></sup> he has referred to it as his identity.<sup id="cite_ref-cheesegrater_231-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cheesegrater-231">[231]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>A <a href="/w/index.php?title=Sleeve_tattoo&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Sleeve tattoo (page does not exist)">sleeve tattoo</a> on his left arm that reads "luck is for losers" and features numerous <a href="/wiki/Luck" title="Luck">good luck</a> symbols, including a <a href="/wiki/Rabbit%27s_foot" title="Rabbit's foot">rabbit's foot</a>, <a href="/wiki/Four-leaf_clover" title="Four-leaf clover">four-leaf clover</a> and a <a href="/wiki/Horseshoe" title="Horseshoe">horseshoe</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-wweink_232-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-wweink-232">[232]</a></sup> The tattoo also features four <a href="/wiki/Ace" title="Ace">ace</a> playing cards as a tribute to trainer <a href="/wiki/Ace_Steel" title="Ace Steel">Ace Steel</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-wweink_232-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-wweink-232">[232]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>A tattoo on the back of his left hand reading "No gimmicks needed", a tribute to deceased wrestler <a href="/wiki/Chris_Candido" title="Chris Candido">Chris Candido</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-233" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-233">[233]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>A tattoo across his knuckles with the words "DRUG FREE" ("DRUG" on his right knuckles and "FREE" on his left).<sup id="cite_ref-234" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-234">[234]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-235" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-235">[235]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>A tattoo of his little sister's jersey number (31) behind his left ear surrounded by stars, each of which also representing his siblings as a way to bond away from home.<sup id="cite_ref-Inked_236-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Inked-236">[236]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-237" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-237">[237]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>A tattoo on his right shoulder of the <a href="/wiki/Cobra_Command" title="Cobra Command">Cobra Command</a> logo, <a href="/w/index.php?title=G.I._Joe:_A_Real_American_Hero&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero (page does not exist)">G.I. Joe</a>'s enemy. Punk is well known for his love of comic books, considering them along with <a href="/wiki/Jazz" title="Jazz">jazz</a> and professional wrestling as three of the original arts that America has given to the world.<sup id="cite_ref-Inked_236-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Inked-236">[236]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>A tattoo of a rose on his left wrist.<sup id="cite_ref-238" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-238">[238]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>A tattoo on his knuckles, below the drug free tattoo, that reads "romance" when his fingers are intertwined with an arrowed heart on his left pinkie at the end.<sup id="cite_ref-239" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-239">[239]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
<p>Punk's character has been parodied by the wrestling federation <a href="/w/index.php?title=Chikara_(professional_wrestling)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Chikara (professional wrestling) (page does not exist)">Chikara</a> who used a <a href="/wiki/Mascot" title="Mascot">mascot</a> character <a href="/w/index.php?title=Necro_Butcher&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Necro Butcher (page does not exist)">CP Munk</a>, the straight edge <a href="/wiki/Chipmunk" title="Chipmunk">chipmunk</a>. The character includes references to Punk, such as X-marked wrist tape, a Pepsi logo on the costume's left shoulder, and a high-pitch version of Punk's best-known independent circuit theme song "Miseria Cantare – The Beginning", by the band <a href="/wiki/AFI_(band)" title="AFI (band)">AFI</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-240" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-240">[240]</a></sup> On his website, Punk has said about the character CP Munk, and the people behind it:
<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Cquote&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Cquote (page does not exist)">Template:Cquote</a>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Other_media">Other media</span></h2>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:132px;"><a href="/wiki/File:CM_Punk_como_IC_Champion_en_Madrid,_Espa%C3%B1a.jpg" title="File:CM Punk como IC Champion en Madrid, España.jpg">File:CM Punk como IC Champion en Madrid, España.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">CM Punk at an autograph signing in <a href="/w/index.php?title=Madrid&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Madrid (page does not exist)">Madrid</a>, Spain.</div></div></div>
<p>Punk made an appearance on the February 16, 2004 episode of <i><a href="/wiki/Monster_Garage" title="Monster Garage">Monster Garage</a></i>, "Box Truck Wrestling Car", performing a short match with <a href="/wiki/Samoa_Joe" title="Samoa Joe">Samoa Joe</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-241" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-241">[241]</a></sup> On October 31, 2006, Punk joined <a href="/wiki/The_Atlantic_Paranormal_Society" title="The Atlantic Paranormal Society">The Atlantic Paranormal Society</a> (TAPS) to shoot the <a href="/wiki/Syfy" title="Syfy">Sci Fi Channel</a> special <i><a href="/wiki/Ghost_Hunters#Specials" title="Ghost Hunters">Ghost Hunters Live</a></i>, which was a six-hour show broadcast live <a href="/wiki/Halloween" title="Halloween">Halloween</a> night from the <a href="/wiki/The_Stanley_Hotel" title="The Stanley Hotel">Stanley Hotel</a> in <a href="/wiki/Estes_Park,_Colorado" title="Estes Park, Colorado">Estes Park, Colorado</a>. Initially skeptical about what he might find, Punk claimed to have heard children giggling and footsteps when there were not any children booked into the hotel.<sup id="cite_ref-242" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-242">[242]</a></sup>
</p><p>In 2008, Punk appeared as the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Grand_Marshal&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Grand Marshal (page does not exist)">Sports Grand Marshal</a> of the nationally-televised <a href="/w/index.php?title=McDonald%27s_Thanksgiving_Parade&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="McDonald's Thanksgiving Parade (page does not exist)">McDonald's Thanksgiving Parade</a> in downtown Chicago.<sup id="cite_ref-243" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-243">[243]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-244" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-244">[244]</a></sup> He reprised this role in 2012.<sup id="cite_ref-245" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-245">[245]</a></sup>
</p><p>Punk made his <a href="/wiki/Video_game" title="Video game">video game</a> debut in <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=WWE_SmackDown_vs_Raw_2008&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WWE SmackDown vs Raw 2008 (page does not exist)">WWE SmackDown vs Raw 2008</a></i><sup id="cite_ref-246" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-246">[246]</a></sup> and has also been a playable character in <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=WWE_SmackDown_vs_Raw_2009&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WWE SmackDown vs Raw 2009 (page does not exist)">WWE SmackDown vs Raw 2009</a></i>,<sup id="cite_ref-247" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-247">[247]</a></sup> <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=WWE_SmackDown_vs_Raw_2010&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WWE SmackDown vs Raw 2010 (page does not exist)">WWE SmackDown vs Raw 2010</a></i>,<sup id="cite_ref-248" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-248">[248]</a></sup> <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=WWE_All_Stars&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WWE All Stars (page does not exist)">WWE All Stars</a></i>,<sup id="cite_ref-249" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-249">[249]</a></sup> <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=WWE_SmackDown_vs_Raw_2011&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WWE SmackDown vs Raw 2011 (page does not exist)">WWE SmackDown vs Raw 2011</a></i>,<sup id="cite_ref-250" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-250">[250]</a></sup> <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=WWE_%2712&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WWE '12 (page does not exist)">WWE '12</a></i>,<sup id="cite_ref-251" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-251">[251]</a></sup> <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=WWE_2K14&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WWE 2K14 (page does not exist)">WWE 2K14</a></i><sup id="cite_ref-252" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-252">[252]</a></sup> as well as being the cover star for <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=WWE_%2713&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="WWE '13 (page does not exist)">WWE '13</a></i>.<sup id="cite_ref-253" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-253">[253]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-254" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-254">[254]</a></sup>
</p><p>On July 15, 2011, CM Punk threw out the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ceremonial_first_pitch&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ceremonial first pitch (page does not exist)">ceremonial first pitch</a> at <a href="/wiki/Wrigley_Field" title="Wrigley Field">Wrigley Field</a> before a <a href="/wiki/Chicago_Cubs" title="Chicago Cubs">Chicago Cubs</a> game.<sup id="cite_ref-255" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-255">[255]</a></sup> On May 8, 2012, Punk returned to Wrigley Field to throw out the first pitch before the Cubs vs. <a href="/wiki/Atlanta_Braves" title="Atlanta Braves">Braves</a> game.<sup id="cite_ref-256" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-256">[256]</a></sup> He also threw the first pitch at the <a href="/wiki/New_York_Mets" title="New York Mets">New York Mets</a> vs. <a href="/wiki/Miami_Marlins" title="Miami Marlins">Miami Marlins</a> game on April 5, 2013 at <a href="/wiki/Citi_Field" title="Citi Field">Citi Field</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-257" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-257">[257]</a></sup>
</p><p>Punk appeared at the 2011 <a href="/wiki/San_Diego_Comic-Con_International" title="San Diego Comic-Con International">San Diego Comic Con</a><sup id="cite_ref-ComicCon1_140-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ComicCon1-140">[140]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-ComicCon2_141-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ComicCon2-141">[141]</a></sup> and at the 2012 <a href="/wiki/Wizard_Entertainment" title="Wizard Entertainment">Wizard World</a> <a href="/wiki/Philadelphia" title="Philadelphia">Philadelphia</a> Comic Con where he hosted a Q&amp;A session.<sup id="cite_ref-ComicCon2012_258-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ComicCon2012-258">[258]</a></sup> He is scheduled to appear at the 2014 Wizard World <a href="/wiki/Portland,_Oregon" title="Portland, Oregon">Portland</a> Comic Con on January 24, 2014.<sup id="cite_ref-259" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-259">[259]</a></sup>
</p><p>CM Punk has made appearances on <i><a href="/wiki/Jimmy_Kimmel_Live!" title="Jimmy Kimmel Live!">Jimmy Kimmel Live!</a></i>,<sup id="cite_ref-JimmyKimmel_260-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-JimmyKimmel-260">[260]</a></sup> <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Late_Night_with_Jimmy_Fallon&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Late Night with Jimmy Fallon (page does not exist)">Late Night with Jimmy Fallon</a></i><sup id="cite_ref-JimmyFallon_261-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-JimmyFallon-261">[261]</a></sup> and has reported the weather on <i><a href="/wiki/Fox_News_Channel" title="Fox News Channel">Fox News</a> 59</i>.<sup id="cite_ref-FoxNews59_262-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FoxNews59-262">[262]</a></sup>
</p><p>Punk's entrance was emulated by Australian <a href="/wiki/Darts" title="Darts">darts</a> player <a href="/w/index.php?title=Paul_Nicholson_(darts_player)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Paul Nicholson (darts player) (page does not exist)">Paul Nicholson</a> during the <a href="/w/index.php?title=2011_World_Matchplay_(darts)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2011 World Matchplay (darts) (page does not exist)">2011 World Matchplay</a> and the <a href="/w/index.php?title=2011_PDC_World_Darts_Championship&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2011 PDC World Darts Championship (page does not exist)">2011 PDC World Darts Championship</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-263" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-263">[263]</a></sup><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Dead_link&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Dead link (page does not exist)">Template:Dead link</a>
</p><p>On February 13, 2012, Punk appeared alongside his friend and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Brazilian_Jiu-Jitsu&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu (page does not exist)">Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu</a> coach <a href="/w/index.php?title=Rener_Gracie&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Rener Gracie (page does not exist)">Rener Gracie</a> for an edition of <i>Gracie Breakdown</i>, a <a href="/w/index.php?title=YouTube&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="YouTube (page does not exist)">YouTube</a> series that explains <a href="/wiki/Mixed_martial_arts" title="Mixed martial arts">mixed martial arts</a> matches and specifically the BJJ techniques used in them. In the episode, he helped explain the techniques used in the <a href="/w/index.php?title=UFC_4&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="UFC 4 (page does not exist)">UFC 4</a> match between <a href="/wiki/Royce_Gracie" title="Royce Gracie">Royce Gracie</a> and <a href="/wiki/Dan_Severn" title="Dan Severn">Dan Severn</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-264" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-264">[264]</a></sup>
</p><p>Punk featured in the <a href="/wiki/WWE_Studios" title="WWE Studios">WWE Studios</a> and Kare Production project, "Les reines du ring" (English: Queens of the ring), with fellow wrestlers <a href="/w/index.php?title=Eve_Torres&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Eve Torres (page does not exist)">Eve Torres</a> and <a href="/wiki/The_Miz" title="The Miz">The Miz</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-265" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-265">[265]</a></sup>
</p><p>Punk wrote the introduction for the hardcover edition of <a href="/wiki/Marvel_Comics" title="Marvel Comics">Marvel Comics'</a> 2012 <a href="/wiki/Fictional_crossover" title="Fictional crossover">crossover event</a> <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Avengers_vs._X-Men&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Avengers vs. X-Men (page does not exist)">Avengers vs. X-Men</a></i>.<sup id="cite_ref-PunkMarvelIntro_266-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PunkMarvelIntro-266">[266]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-USAToday_267-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-USAToday-267">[267]</a></sup> He was interviewed for Marvel's official website, Marvel.com, and, when Punk was asked what it was like to write the introduction, he said: <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Cquote&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Cquote (page does not exist)">Template:Cquote</a>
</p><p>In 2013, Punk wrote a <a href="/wiki/Foreword" title="Foreword">foreword</a> for his friend and ex-girlfriend Natalie Slater's <a href="/wiki/Cookbook" title="Cookbook">cookbook</a> <i>Bake and Destroy: Good Foods for Bad Vegans</i>.<sup id="cite_ref-BakeandDestroyBook_268-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BakeandDestroyBook-268">[268]</a></sup> The book also featured a cupcake <a href="/wiki/Recipe" title="Recipe">recipe</a> inspired by Punk's long-time friend <a href="/wiki/Samoa_Joe" title="Samoa Joe">Samoa Joe</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-BookForewordTweet_269-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BookForewordTweet-269">[269]</a></sup>
</p><p>As part of <a href="/w/index.php?title=YouTube_Comedy_Week&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="YouTube Comedy Week (page does not exist)">YouTube Comedy Week</a> 2013, Punk starred in a YouTube series, <i>CM Punk's Grammar Slam</i>, on <a href="/w/index.php?title=Nerdist_Industries&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Nerdist Industries (page does not exist)">Nerdist Industries</a> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Nerdist_Industries&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Nerdist Industries (page does not exist)">YouTube channel</a> explaining grammatical mistakes in messages from wrestling fans and berating the senders.<sup id="cite_ref-270" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-270">[270]</a></sup> He has also appeared on <a href="/w/index.php?title=Nerdist_Industries&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Nerdist Industries (page does not exist)"><i>The Nerdist Podcast</i></a><sup id="cite_ref-271" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-271">[271]</a></sup> as well as <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Talking_Dead&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Talking Dead (page does not exist)">Talking Dead</a></i>, which recapped on the <a href="/w/index.php?title=When_the_Dead_Come_Knocking&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="When the Dead Come Knocking (page does not exist)">November 25, 2012 episode</a> of <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=The_Walking_Dead_(TV_series)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="The Walking Dead (TV series) (page does not exist)">The Walking Dead</a></i>.<sup id="cite_ref-272" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-272">[272]</a></sup>
</p><p>In November 2013, Punk was the headlining performer on the <i>I Shit You Not</i> comedy show at Lincoln Lodge in his hometown of <a href="/wiki/Chicago" title="Chicago">Chicago</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-273" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-273">[273]</a></sup>
</p><p>In early 2015, Punk is expected to star in the <a href="/wiki/Warner_Bros._Animation" title="Warner Bros. Animation">Warner Bros.</a> and <a href="/wiki/WWE_Studios" title="WWE Studios">WWE Studios</a> <a href="/wiki/Direct-to-video" title="Direct-to-video">direct-to-video</a> animated movie, <i><a href="/wiki/The_Flintstones" title="The Flintstones">Flintstones</a></i>, alongside WWE <a href="/wiki/Chief_executive_officer" title="Chief executive officer">CEO</a> <a href="/wiki/Vince_McMahon" title="Vince McMahon">Vince McMahon</a> and <a href="/wiki/John_Cena" title="John Cena">John Cena</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-274" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-274">[274]</a></sup> He will voice the character "CM Punkrock".<sup id="cite_ref-275" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-275">[275]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-276" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-276">[276]</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Personal_life">Personal life</span></h2>
<p>Brooks is an <a href="/w/index.php?title=Atheism&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Atheism (page does not exist)">atheist</a><sup id="cite_ref-277" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-277">[277]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-278" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-278">[278]</a></sup> and a <a href="/w/index.php?title=Pescetarianism&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Pescetarianism (page does not exist)">pescetarian</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-279" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-279">[279]</a></sup> He is an avid fan of the <a href="/wiki/Chicago_Blackhawks" title="Chicago Blackhawks">Chicago Blackhawks</a><sup id="cite_ref-Blackhawks_280-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Blackhawks-280">[280]</a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/Chicago_Cubs" title="Chicago Cubs">Chicago Cubs</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Cubs_281-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Cubs-281">[281]</a></sup> In his spare time, he reads and collects <a href="/wiki/Comic_book" title="Comic book">comics</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-PunkMarvelIntro_266-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PunkMarvelIntro-266">[266]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-USAToday_267-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-USAToday-267">[267]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-MarveldotcomPunk_282-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-MarveldotcomPunk-282">[282]</a></sup> He once worked for a shop named All American Comics,<sup id="cite_ref-PunkMarvelInterview_228-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PunkMarvelInterview-228">[228]</a></sup> and cites <i><a href="/wiki/Preacher_(comics)" title="Preacher (comics)">Preacher</a></i> as his favorite comic.<sup id="cite_ref-FaveComic_283-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FaveComic-283">[283]</a></sup> He is close friends with fellow professional wrestler <a href="/wiki/Colt_Cabana" title="Colt Cabana">Colt Cabana</a>, whom he met when he trained at Steel Domain Wrestling,<sup id="cite_ref-punkcabana_14-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-punkcabana-14">[14]</a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/Rancid_(band)" title="Rancid (band)">Rancid</a> vocalist <a href="/wiki/Lars_Frederiksen" title="Lars Frederiksen">Lars Frederiksen</a>, who WWE interviewed for their documentary <i>CM Punk: Best in the World</i>.<sup id="cite_ref-LarsDVD_284-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-LarsDVD-284">[284]</a></sup>
</p><p>While working for <a href="/wiki/Ring_of_Honor" title="Ring of Honor">Ring of Honor</a>, Brooks was romantically linked to professional wrestlers <a href="/wiki/Daffney" title="Daffney">Shannon Spruill</a><sup id="cite_ref-285" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-285">[285]</a></sup> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Tracy_Brookshaw&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Tracy Brookshaw (page does not exist)">Tracy Brookshaw</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-joepunk_15-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-joepunk-15">[15]</a></sup> After joining <a href="/wiki/Ohio_Valley_Wrestling" title="Ohio Valley Wrestling">Ohio Valley Wrestling</a> he began dating <a href="/wiki/Maria_Kanellis" title="Maria Kanellis">Maria Kanellis</a>, who was an interviewer there.<sup id="cite_ref-286" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-286">[286]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-287" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-287">[287]</a></sup> They broke up sometime after Punk moved to <a href="/wiki/WWE#World_Wrestling_Entertainment" title="WWE">World Wrestling Entertainment</a>'s <a href="/w/index.php?title=ECW_(WWE)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="ECW (WWE) (page does not exist)">ECW</a> brand.<sup id="cite_ref-288" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-288">[288]</a></sup> Punk dated <a href="/w/index.php?title=Amy_Dumas&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Amy Dumas (page does not exist)">Amy Dumas</a> for over a year around 2009.<sup id="cite_ref-289" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-289">[289]</a></sup> In March 2010, <a href="/wiki/Matt_Hardy" title="Matt Hardy">Matt Hardy</a> said the two were no longer dating.<sup id="cite_ref-290" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-290">[290]</a></sup> In April 2013, it was reported that he and Dumas were back together; however, they ceased dating later in 2013.<sup id="cite_ref-291" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-291">[291]</a></sup> In December 2013, it was reported that Punk is currently in a relationship with <a href="/w/index.php?title=AJ_Lee&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="AJ Lee (page does not exist)">AJ Lee</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-292" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-292">[292]</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="In_wrestling">In wrestling</span></h2>
<p><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Multiple_image&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Multiple image (page does not exist)">Template:Multiple image</a>
</p>
<ul>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/WWE" title="WWE">World Wrestling Entertainment</a></b>
<ul>
<li><b>Finishing moves</b>
<ul>
<li><i>Anaconda Vise</i> (<a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_holds#Anaconda_vise" title="Professional wrestling holds">Arm-trap triangle choke</a>)<sup id="cite_ref-wwebio_293-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-wwebio-293">[293]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-294" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-294">[294]</a></sup>
</li>
<li><i>GTS – Go To Sleep</i> (<a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_attacks#Go_2_Sleep" title="Professional wrestling attacks">Fireman's carry dropped into a knee lift</a>)<sup id="cite_ref-wwebio_293-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-wwebio-293">[293]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><b>Signature moves</b>
<ul>
<li><a href="/w/index.php?title=Swinging_neckbreaker&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Swinging neckbreaker (page does not exist)">Arm trap swinging neckbreaker</a><sup id="cite_ref-WDProfile_295-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WDProfile-295">[295]</a></sup>
</li>
<li><a href="/w/index.php?title=Arm_wrench&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Arm wrench (page does not exist)">Arm wrench</a> followed by stepping a leg over the wrenched arm and performing a <a href="/w/index.php?title=Mule_kick&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Mule kick (page does not exist)">mule kick</a> with the leg below the opponent's face<sup id="cite_ref-owwpunk_17-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-owwpunk-17">[17]</a></sup>
</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Suplex#Belly-to-back_suplex" title="Suplex">Belly-to-back suplex</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-vsJericho2013_296-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-vsJericho2013-296">[296]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-vsCenaMITB_297-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-vsCenaMITB-297">[297]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-RAW1000_298-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-RAW1000-298">[298]</a></sup> sometimes from the top rope<sup id="cite_ref-vsBryanMITB_299-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-vsBryanMITB-299">[299]</a></sup>
</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/DDT_(professional_wrestling)" title="DDT (professional wrestling)">DDT</a><sup id="cite_ref-DDT1_300-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DDT1-300">[300]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-DDT2_301-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DDT2-301">[301]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-DDT3_302-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DDT3-302">[302]</a></sup>
</li>
<li><a href="/w/index.php?title=Diving_Crossbody&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Diving Crossbody (page does not exist)">Diving crossbody</a><sup id="cite_ref-officialsite_303-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-officialsite-303">[303]</a></sup>
</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_aerial_techniques#Diving_elbow_drop" title="Professional wrestling aerial techniques">Diving elbow drop</a><sup id="cite_ref-WDProfile_295-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WDProfile-295">[295]</a></sup> – adopted from and used in tribute to <a href="/wiki/Randy_Savage" title="Randy Savage">Randy Savage</a><sup id="cite_ref-Inked_236-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Inked-236">[236]</a></sup>
</li>
<li><i>Pepsi Twist</i><sup id="cite_ref-officialsite_303-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-officialsite-303">[303]</a></sup> (<a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_holds#Hammerlock" title="Professional wrestling holds">Hammerlock</a> <a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_attacks#Spinning_headlock_elbow_drop" title="Professional wrestling attacks">twisted</a> into a <a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_attacks#Lariat" title="Professional wrestling attacks">short-range lariat</a>)<sup id="cite_ref-owwpunk_17-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-owwpunk-17">[17]</a></sup>
</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_holds#Koji_Clutch" title="Professional wrestling holds">Koji Clutch</a><sup id="cite_ref-wwebio_293-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-wwebio-293">[293]</a></sup>
</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_attacks#Mongolian_chop" title="Professional wrestling attacks">Mongolian chop</a><sup id="cite_ref-WDProfile_295-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WDProfile-295">[295]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Multiple <a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_attacks#Kick" title="Professional wrestling attacks">kick</a> variations
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_attacks#Leg_lariat" title="Professional wrestling attacks">Leg lariat</a><sup id="cite_ref-RAW1000_298-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-RAW1000-298">[298]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-304" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-304">[304]</a></sup>
</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Muay_Thai#Kicking_.28Te.29" title="Muay Thai">Muay Thai</a><sup id="cite_ref-owwpunk_17-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-owwpunk-17">[17]</a></sup>
</li>
<li><a href="/w/index.php?title=Roundhouse_kick&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Roundhouse kick (page does not exist)">Roundhouse</a><sup id="cite_ref-WDProfile_295-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WDProfile-295">[295]</a></sup>
</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Enzuigiri" title="Enzuigiri" class="mw-redirect">Step-up enzuigiri</a><sup id="cite_ref-owwpunk_17-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-owwpunk-17">[17]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_holds#Bite_of_the_Dragon" title="Professional wrestling holds">Rope hung</a> <a href="/wiki/Professional_wrestling_holds#Anaconda_vise" title="Professional wrestling holds">arm trap</a> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Kubihishigi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Kubihishigi (page does not exist)">can opener</a><sup id="cite_ref-Obs1_305-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Obs1-305">[305]</a></sup>
</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Suplex#Sitout_suplex_slam" title="Suplex">Sitout suplex slam</a><sup id="cite_ref-WDProfile_295-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WDProfile-295">[295]</a></sup>
</li>
